reviews.text: I took my little cousins out for a pre-Christmas dinner after a long afternoon of shopping. As we were getting seated, we were offered the seating area which individual chairs which obviously was not a good seating selection for little kids. I asked for a booth &amp; the hostess sort of shrugged and begrudgingly gave us a booth. She was acting like it was a full house &amp; my seat selection would be deducted from her check, sigh. Anyways, I ordered the Jamaican shrimp, rice &amp; plantain, while the kids got pizza. My meal was very delicious which shocked me because it was a Jamaican dish being prepared at a chain restaurant. I will definitely good back again &amp; order the same meal.

Sorry to say I see what the negative reviews are about.  The quality of the food is completely awful.  Both our orange chicken dishes and miso salmon.  I won&#39;t detail but for once am actually going to contact the Manager about the food quality we were served.   Ten years ago Cheesecake Factory had great quality entrees, along with huge portions and good, fresh bread.  Even the bread tasted stale.  They also shrunk the portions big time, not that it mattered because the food wasn&#39;t really edible.<br>The pumpkin cheesecake and ice cream sundae still tasted very good.  Go for dessert!

The cheesecake factory never ceases to impress. What about lunch, dinner, or a Sunday brunch I am usually very please with the food and the service. Today was no different. After a little while in the mall for holiday shopping, we went here for a quick lunch. I started off with a chicken tortilla soup which had a great taste and a slight kick. My wife had her favorite lettuce wraps, and I had southern grilled chicken sandwich. Everything was tasty, and our service was great. I expect nothing less
The buffalo blasts and egg rolls are our favorite appetizers. The fried mac &amp; cheese balls are very good as well. Plenty of dishes to choose from. Staff was very friendly.

Usually a hit or miss. Last night was a total miss. We were given a waitress who was on break (says staff) and covered by another. Food was good, I got one of the breaded chicken dishes with asparagus and mashed potatoes and my bf got the pasta neopolatano which he really liked (sauce on the side because he doesn&#39;t like mushrooms). He liked the mix of meats in it. We also had a small app of Nashville chicken nuggets that were spicy and had pickles with them. So good. Reason why 2 stars is because with the waitress swapping, my bf got his dinner and nearly finished it (he cant wait and he didn&#39;t want it to get cold) and I didn&#39;t get my dish til a good 15 mins later. Kind of sucky just to be sitting there waiting for food while our partner is delivered his much sooner. Not cool. And why would we get a waitress who was on break?

No complaints about the food, everything was delicious. We timed it right with no wait, even on a Saturday night. The service was pretty quick up until after our food came, but the manager did not hesitate to step up. He wrapped our leftovers and reassured us our dessert would be out shortly. If it wasn&#39;t for him, our experience could have quickly turned poor.

The meal itself, was fulfilling! 5 star if you&#39;re a fried Mac n cheese kind of person this burger is for you as the cheese melted down  with just one bite. And it&#39;s huge even to close. Now the avocado by itself I would give a 2 star maybe even less, it wasn&#39;t fresh, had no flavor besides the avocado being weirdly hot, the inside was soggy and the outside was cold and hard a lot of weird texture combinations and hurt my stomach afterwards. :( so it was half good half bad depending what you get

CF is a chain Restaraunt with the largest menu I have ever seen .  <br>The good : Been here multiple times with family, we have never had a bad meal. My favorite is the grilled fish tacos but my family orders lots of other things and they&#39;re always pleased with the food. The desserts are wonderful and their carrot cake is my favorite. <br>the bad : the noise level is deafening, I actually have to use earplugs or I won&#39;t go   Cocktails are expensive and often just awful. I no longer order a mixed drink here. <br>The ugly: it&#39;s too hard to stay on diet

The service is great, the waiters are very kind and fast. The food is absolutely terrible. I&#39;ve been eating here for a number of years and have not ever had just disgusting food, ESPECIALLY NOT FROM CHEESECAKE FACTORY. My pasta was inedible but my girlfriends was dry and bland. This will be my last time eating here.

I love everything about the Cheese cake factory except their huge lines (I wish they took reservations). Trumbull is quite far for me plus the calorie listing against all my favorite dishes gives me chills, so I am not a regular. But whenever I am so happy and want to eat something I really like, this is my go to place. I love their margaritas, corn cakes, avocado egg rolls, veggie burger, Mexican dishes and above all cheese cakes. My husband who is a meat/seafood lover likes those too.
Too many choices on the menu - turned off by the pic with the maggots in the food. They did add the peas to the Mac and cheese when I asked which was nice and the avocado toast had a great taste.

Ive been to other locations numerous times. We stopped in early evening. It wasnt crowded so tgeir was no wait (Tuesday). Our waitress was great, she told us the specials and then went to get us bread. We had the spinach artichoke for an app...no flavor what so ever. I ordered a hamburger with fries medium well. Since I&#39;ve never had a burger here before I said why not. The burger was cooked perfectly the fries were great. I had to wait a while for more ketchup because it wasnt enough. My sister had the blazin shrimp (I think thats what it was called). There was nothing fancy or spicy about it. In fact the fried shrimp was soggy. No crunch. My sister ate 1 but felt bad about sending it back so she ate my fries instead..smh <br>The place started to fill up a bit and we just couldnt get a hold of our waitress. We wanted dessert and the bill. About 10 mins later we took our dessert to go and paid our bill<br>For dessert I had the red velvet cheesecake and my sis had the lemon raspberry cheesecake. Both were great....2 stars for the shrimp, spinach artichoke dip and the wait for ordering dessert and getting the bill.

This place is usually great. Most of things on the menu are good.<br><br>I kept looking at the shepherds pie on the menu. Decided to order it last night. After all, its a simple<br>dish......what could go wrong?<br><br>The meat was dumped into a fancy plate and covered over with mashed potatos. Again....what would be expected as its generally homestyle anyway.<br><br>The disturbing part is that the meat was very oily and just not good. Meat literally sitting in a pool of oil. I had a few bites and I felt sick. Just a gelotonous mess. Felt sick all through the night. <br><br>Note to self: Stick with the things they advertise as being their &#34;specialties&#34;.......don&#39;t venture off to other things no matter how simple you think the dish sounds.
This is just a regular old Cheesecake Factory. The dim lighting is kind of annoying but other than that it&#39;s fine. The staff is friendly and attentive and the menu is extensive.

Not worth a 45 minute wait to get called, then 15 minutes waiting for someone to show us to a table then almost 20 minutes to get someone to take our order. Spent $100 for 3 people and personally, my food wasn&#39;t that good. My cheesecake was not good at all and that  was a surprise because I&#39;ve had their cheesecake before and it was good. Maybe it&#39;s time to take The Cheesecake Factory off my menu.

I&#39;m a little shocked by all the low star reviews of this place! It&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory! They have a certain standard of food and quality and this place certainly meets it! Arriving on a Saturday afternoon at about 1PM, I didn&#39;t have to wait for a table and was seated right away. Our waitress was awesome! She came by right away to take drink orders and kept my water glass filled throughout lunch without me having to ask. She stopped by several times to make sure everything was okay and I never felt like I had to hunt her down. I had the salmon kale salad and my husband had the poke. I especially enjoyed the tart salad dressing and garlic almond cream topping on the salmon. My husband thought the poke was ok. It had a slight gingery taste which he did not enjoy. I also had the passion mint fizz (no alcohol) which had passion fruit, mint and soda water but I personally prefer the flavored lemonades more.

My family and I came to The Cheesecake Factory for lunch on a Sunday. We were seated quickly at a large booth and were greeted by our waitress soon after.<br><br>My dad and I both ordered the California omelet, my mom and Aunt both had lunch-sized salads (one Santa Fe and one Sheila), and my grandmother had the brioche French toast. Everything came out as ordered and everything tasted great. My 86 y.o. grandmother even told our waitress that it was the best French toast she&#39;s ever had... it was pretty cute.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is not my favorite restaurant and it certainly isn&#39;t the best food in the world- but as far as chain restaurants in the suburbs go, our experience was pleasant, we had no issues with our service, and we all enjoyed our food.
Friendly atmosphere. Great for diverse groups with picky eaters!  Something for everyone on the menu.
Love it my favorite place the staff is amazing and the food is delicious and all prepared  in house.

Fine restaurant and great looking on the inside. Service was also very good in my opinion. Food came out quickly, even though the place was very busy on a Saturday night. The food was fine, fresh ingredients as far as I could tell. Certainly on the pricey side and the food was not seasoned. I got the shrimp dish in a tomato sauce and my date got the fettuccine Alfredo (which unfortunately does not come with any meat, though it should). The bread was good, but not warm.

FINALLY LOOKED DOWN AFTER THE 7th WING (after indulging in half cooked buffalo blasts,&amp; wet pizza)! I think I&#39;m going to DIE!!!! I waited 40mins for my food- isn&#39;t that enough time to at least cook it?! What is happening to the CF we all know and love?!

Sooo! I went back here after a 4 year hiatus, choosing the  Westchester location as my main go to spot. Can&#39;t say I wasn&#39;t disappointed again. I ordered a to go of (not to mention I waited 23 min on hold) of Thai lettuce wraps with charcoaled, sorry burnt chicken, with a juicy uncooked pink in the middle. The cheeseburger egg rolls were pretty good though. I also ordered something else I can&#39;t remember that was good as well. Overall, be careful with the chicken, I re-cooked it at home. The sad part was they didn&#39;t even offer a we&#39;re sorry for putting you on hold so we&#39;ll take 10% off. Nada.

This is not the first time we have eaten at the Cheesecake Factory in Trumbull. <br><br>The atmosphere is nice, friendly staff - all our needs were met, prices are within reason if you stay within the menu and do not order any extras, <br><br>They also, offer a wide variety of food selections everything you can imagine (can get a little confusing); if you order the regular size meals they are quite big and well worth the price.<br><br>We went on Tuesday afternoon for lunch and we were seated right away.<br><br>This visit we ordered the Old Fashioned Burger and the Chicken, Mango, and Avocado salad which were both delicious. <br><br>Other menu items I can recommend they are very good are: <br><br>Thai Lettuce Wraps<br>Fried Macaroni and Cheese<br>Pork Belly Sliders<br>Fried Calamari<br>Avocado Eggrolls<br>Chicken Pot Stickers<br>Factory Burrito Grande<br>Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo<br>Fried Shrimp Platter<br>Fish and Chip Platter<br>Santa Fe Salad<br><br>Needless to say, we have never tried their cheesecakes. They are a little pricy.

I have been numerous times and I think the fact of the matter is: when there are so many options it&#39;s hard to have specialties. Everything is just &#34;alright.&#34; I have tried many things and nothing blows me away. Interestingly enough the two menu items I did enjoy (Eggplant Parmesan and Falafel Salad) have been removed from the menu. I do enjoy the cheesecakes, however (Oreo and Hazelnut Crunch are faves). I should note: the service at this location is always very good!
The farfalle was good but not worth $18.00!!! The place was empty on a Saturday night and now I know why, $9.00 for a piece of cheesecake, this isn&#39;t New York

The only thing good is the cheesecakes and the Mac and cheese balls , food is over cooked and greasy especially if it has to be fired  you will not any lotion  on you hands that day if you decide a fried item at this location , pass on it will be burnt . Very disappointing . I wanted to cancel the wings but I just sent the cheese burger egg rolls which came out greasy and burnt , my fingers was trying to drain the grease. Didn&#39;t work
Terrible!! I will never, ever return!! I DO NOT recommend!! Don&#39;t wait your time or money. Cause it ain&#39;t cheap either!

Was a little Leary going in. I walked in to use the restroom while I waited and saw a lot of tables with barely touched food. Or burgers with one bite, but the table was empty. Usually these are not good signs. When we checked the reviews, we were even more skeptical that we would have a decent experience.  However since we were on a long road trip and I was absolutely starving I figure I would give it a shot, Cheesecake Factory never really gave me a problem in the past.<br><br>All in all the food was okay, although a few misses occurred. The drinks took a while to come to the table. They ran out of bread, so we had to wait for that to be ready, and by the time it came out the main course was already put on the table. The second cocktail had some debris inside of the drink. In the fashion of &#34;alcohol disinfects all&#34; I just fished it out with a spoon and kept on trucking.<br><br>Our waitress Emily was friendly and pleasant to work with during our visit. Her bright demeanor and happy and bright energy made the stay enjoyable.

Cheesecake factory is usually hit or miss. This one is not for me for a couple of reasons. One is that it is quite noisy. Second is the atmosphere is to bland, meaning there is not much atmosphere, it&#39;s just all noise and being in the mall doesn&#39;t help since I am not a fan of this mall. Also I have a few friends who had a few bad experiences here, one with under cooking and over cooking of food. That was awhile ago but still. I have found that the quality of Cheesecake factories does vary from one to another even though it is a chain. I would not go back here.
I eat here all the time and the food is superb.  I recommend the grilled salmon, steak Diane, or the chicken and waffles!!

Words can&#39;t describe the enjoyable atmosphere here, everyone has bright smiles and a good attitude. The spinach artichoke dip what outstanding it was a must try! I had the Louisiana chicken pasta (pictured with review) had a incredible bend of taste and spices. Furthermore our server Jennifer was out of this world I would recommend her when you visit, she was always checking in and making sure we had everything we needed.

We came here on a Saturday night and there wasn&#39;t much of a wait. I went with my favorite dish, the shrimp scampi. The noodles were a little clumpy, but it still tasted good. Our server Tatiana was very attentive. I took away a star because it irks me when restaurants calculate the suggested tip on the post tax amount. It belittles my gratuities and seems disingenuous to others who don&#39;t know better.
Cheesecake was great, but we got Filet Mignon and it was so salty we sent it back so my birthday dinner was ruined so we went to McDonald&#39;s instead

This review is from last Monday.<br><br>Let me start by saying I&#39;m not a fan of the Cheesecake Factory, only thought it to be over-rated, too hyped and expensive.  My wife, Mother-in-law and I were in the mall and decided to get a bite to eat. This place was close by, so we chose to eat here (even-though it isn&#39;t not my favorite restaurant I went with the flow). Wasn&#39;t busy so we were seated quickly, the restaurant was nicely decorated to create a relaxed atmosphere (not sure if all locations are the same within the CF chain).  Overall our experience was pleasant, we had no issues with our service, and we all enjoyed our food. Friendly staff, quick service, waitress was excellent.  I ordered the avocado egg-rolls and they were delicious!  <br><br>I may give the CF another try in the future, before I become a fan though.

One of our favorite restaurants!  Prompt service, great food, good drinks, not to mention the amazing desserts!  We got an appetizer and 3 entrees which was enough for the 4 of us to share and still have leftovers. Then (of course) 2 cheesecakes. Can&#39;t resist!  We&#39;ll be back!

Our waitress totally exceeded expectations. It is rare now a days to get a server who really &#34;gets it&#34;. FINALLY. Thank you CRYSTAL for creating a very pleasant dining experience. She routinely checked up on us, answered any questions patiently and sincerely. There was no issues once-so-ever. Other than our A++ server, the food was great. Got the honey bourbon martini and was PERFECT.<br>Lovely experience thanks to crystal and the very good menus.

Came here for a nice dinner, and was seated in a bother behind three unruly teenage girl celebrating a birthday. The whole time we were eating the would bang on the window and show random passerby&#39;s something on their phones. While we ate several young and older males came into the restaurant to talk to them. I went to complain and no one ever came and said anything to them and they continued to make noise and be disruptive. Finally our server came to the table and my husband said something to her. She told the manager but the paid their bill and left before anyone came and said anything to them. It&#39;s not the first time I&#39;ve been here but it most definitely will be my last as they staff and management don&#39;t care about other customers comfort while dinning at their restaurant.

This Cheesecake Factory is amazing! we came for my father&#39;s birthday tonight and everything was fabulous. We started with an Asian pear martini for mom, spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer followed by crispy battered fish and chips for Dad, Madeira chicken pasta, and a garlic chicken pasta for mom. The service was prompt the food came out fast and was hot fresh andand delicious!

Ordered through Door Dash.  Chicken Taquitos were delivered as Beef Taquitos, and the BBQ Ranch chicken salad came without BBQ Ranch dressing.  Called CF who put me on hold saying I had to talk to Bakery Manager.  After 5 minutes on hold was told I had to take it up with Door Dash.  This is not the first time they&#39;ve messed up orders to go and it is very obvious that they couldn&#39;t care less as they had no interest in trying to make it right or even hint at an apology of any sort.

Came on Valentines Day , the wait was an hour . Not bad for V day. Very nice friendly waitress. Food  was delicious , my fav appetizers are the Mac and cheese balls and avocado rolls. To die forrrr! The bestttt. I Was disappointed with my entree, verryyyy small portion. I got the truffle honey chicken with mashed potatoes and asparagus.

Good food.  Good service.  It&#39;s not cheap but it&#39;s not expensive.  <br><br>You know what you get with Cheesecake Factory.  Their food is ****. One of the better restuarant around here.  Service was a bit shake at first but they seem to have it together now.  Juniors cheesecake is better but this will do since it is close. <br><br>Surprisingly their brunch is very good.  Their Lemon Ricotta Pancakes are VERY Good!

Don&#39;t understand on why there&#39;s so many people giving bad reviews. Literally went there for lunch and was in and out. Was seated quickly and the waitress came right over to take our drink order. As she brought out the drinks she also brought out bread and was on the ball the whole time. Food was really good especially the orange chicken along with the avocado toast.

Let&#39;s start with the noise. It was so loud that you couldn&#39;t hear the hostess call your name. It was so loud you couldn&#39;t hear the waitress when she spoke. Now let&#39;s go onto what they ran out of: silverware and napkins, brown bread, tuna for the tuna salad. And last but not least is the food. Their salads were always the draw for us. They don&#39;t have tuna (and the waitress even questioned why it is on the menu). The chicken in our salads was almost inedible. It was dry and hard. And there wasn&#39;t very much of it. There were ingredients in the salad that were not listed. The portions are large, but if they are not good, no reason to go.

Me and my family go too the Cheesecake Factory a few times every month, we love it! The staff is always so accommodating at the Trumbull location and fast service at the bar stool tables! We usually like too see Stephanie in the bar area and she always gets everything perfect and is super friendly. <br><br>There&#39;s Enough choices so everyone is happy and full at the end. I get the guacamole and chips and it is such a large portion I take half of it home and made two amazing meals from it! My family&#39;s also enjoys the Caesar salad, four cheese pasta, the meatloaf, buffalo blast, and even the Mac and cheese burger! 100% would recommend!

I&#39;m here so much it&#39;s ridiculous! Friendliest and knowledgable staff and the food is always 100% Ive never walked out unhappy with anything. They make all their sauces in house, along with many other things that are made to order. They are the place I go when I need consistency and great food. <br>I work at the mall for a side job, and my coworkers and I are in there Atleast 2-3 times a month! <br>We love Cheesecake Factory! Overall 10/10
Great food. Excellent Cheesecake. If it were less expensive I would come here more often. Great special occasion dinner place though.

We waited long to sit but being a Saturday night( hour &amp; 15 mins ) I guess was to be expected. <br>Douglas our server was great. He was friendly and served us well. <br><br>I had the beet salad so goood , we had the fish and chips just ok - and the New Orleans pasta dish with chicken. Was spicy but just ok. <br>We got our. Cheesecakes to go. Delish. The pumpkin one was so creamy and the carrot cake cheesecake was sweet and nutty. Yum. <br>I think I&#39;d come any other day but sat <br>And also the food is Just ok <br>And may I add in Pricey.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! Whenever I have to go to the Trumbull Mall, I make sure to grab some food here. Their Factory Nachos are off the hook! They&#39;re so delicious and not terribly spicy either! I usually get the five cheese pasta for my entree. If you&#39;re worried about it being overly cheesy, don&#39;t. It&#39;s not too cheesy that it overpowers everything else. There&#39;s a perfect balance of cheese, pasta, and sauce. My favorite cheesecake on the menu is definitely the celebration one! I was never a cheesecake fan until they debuted this puppy! Now I can&#39;t go there and not get it. I just have to! It&#39;s so tasty! It&#39;s almost more like a cake rather than a cheesecake. Which is perfect for me. And the strawberry mousse! Oh my god! Just... *Homer drool*<br><br>I went out of my comfort zone not too long ago and ordered the Da Vinci Pasta. I don&#39;t think I&#39;d get it again. It was too earthy and had too strong of a mushroom taste for me. Then again I&#39;m not exactly crazy about mushrooms. If you like mushrooms, you&#39;ll probably enjoy it.

Went for a late dinner on 10/5 sat in the high top bar area and had such a great experience. My family went, 2 adults and 2 young kids. We had tonni as a waitress and it was only her second night and she was awesome. There were also 2 other staff in there named Brett and Andre and they were awesome helping out also. Our orders were taken promptly and our food came out in a good time frame. The manager was also extremely friendly too. We will definitely go back and ask for Tonni as a waitress again! Such a pleasant experience!!

Menu is a little too extensive for me to think they every single dish is going to be made amazing but I have never had any negative complaints when I have gone there. Order from the healthy menu for smaller and healthier portions!

LO,FL over my photo.  Restaurant has only been open 2.5 weeks and silverware is bent.  Yes, there are totally kinks as other people have mentioned, but this is the Cheesecake Factory people.  What do you expect?  Consistent food, consistent service and a consistent atmosphere.  I know I&#39;ll get the same yummy dishes here as I will in Cali or in Florida.  Thank god they opened in Trumbull, CT, thank God!<br><br>And, for the first time ever I tried their gluten free options.  Very, very pleasing.

As with most franchise restaurants, you never know what kind of service you&#39;re gonna get when you go. I&#39;ve been to this particular Cheesecake Factory dozens of times since its grand opening. I&#39;ve had really good waiters and some horrible ones. There are times when the chicken tenders have been fresh, hot and crispy and other times when they tasted like they&#39;d just been popped in a microwave. It really depends on when you go. I find Monday - Thursday after 7 to be the best times to go. Want consistency? The mac n cheese balls are always perfection. You can never go wrong with my favorite cheesecakes: Reese&#39;s, Oreo and the classic cherry. The bread is always good too: sourdough and honey wheat. The raspberry lemonade is good but super sweet... I always water mine down a bit. Bottom line is, the dessert is very good and I always leave feeling full.
Had a hair in my Cuban sandwich recently. Good otherwise is fine. Staff is more friendly than would be expected for a chain

Service and food quality way off.  Starting with service....of our 4 orders, 1 came out first, then 2 more came out about 10 minutes later and the last order, a bacon cheeseburger, was completely missed (served to another guest) and they only realized the mistake after an additional 10 minutes.  For one of the orders they missed adding mustard (both on initial request and then as an after-the-fact side request.  For the MIA burger, they offered a &#34;soup&#34; as an apology (nice gesture, I guess) which took about 10 minutes to come out and then, finally, the BC burger came after another 15 minutes (so basically over 40 minutes after the first person was served).<br><br>So far, we were relatively relaxed about the whole deal...but then the very late burger arrived, it was a nasty, greasy mess served with luke warm fries.  On top of the burger was a thick slab of dripping fat.  Completely unappetizing and we gave up and cut our losses.

Sometimes people really can find anything to complain about. Give it a try for yourself before feeding into a negative review. My husband and I went today for the first time to celebrate our 12th anniversary. It is also the first time we&#39;ve been able to go out together without our children in years. I&#39;m so glad we choose to go to the Cheesecake Factory. Our food was delicious and the service was even better. Our portions were very large and even my husband who can eat a lot left with leftovers for later tonight. I was honestly full after sharing the appetizer with my husband but when my main course came out it looked so good I had to continue eating and I&#39;m glad I did. I honestly can&#39;t wait for something else to celebrate because The Cheesecake Factory will be the spot we choose to go. It is our new favorite and I can&#39;t wait to go back and let my children try it out as well! It&#39;s nice to visit with your significant other, a friend, or even with your children being that I found the atmosphere to intimate, yet also very family friendly. If you&#39;re reading this review and thinking of going I would say go for it! The environment was nice, the staff were friendly and we really enjoyed it. I attached a picture of our appetizer which was their fried Mac and cheese. Can&#39;t go wrong with this, it was great!! Next time I will snap a picture of everything we order. Hope this review helps make your choice to visit, and I hope you enjoy it as much as my husband and I did!

It was our first time here and also it was a very special day so I had a great time had time to go into the mall did a little bit of shopping and then went to eat since they opened later than the mall. I will definitely recommend this location very friendly very nice people the food was very good and the Cucumber lemonade to-die-for delicious you got to try that one. I definitely will go back and visit and of course I have to have the desert of the cheesecake and that too was very rich and tasty
Danbury location usually better than this one. The wait times for meals are long and food never tastes as good as most CF locations. Cheesecake always good though.

Cheesecake Factory seems to be fairly consistent across the board at all locations. Always great service, nice ambiance and reliably good food. Always a good choice for large groups as they have SO MANY options!!<br><br>My go to is the BBQ Ranch Salad (mostly just so I can eat the fried onion rings on top, of course). I&#39;ve never had a bad dessert here either - the white chocolate macadamia cheesecake is heaven!! <br><br>This location was right up to par with the rest - I sat in the bar and my bartender was just lovely. Only issue is the mall parking that you have to contend with. Prepare yourself to walk off all of the food that you just ate while trying to find your car afterwards.

Just Horrible! Wish I can rate -1 Stars. Took my wife and kids tonight for my wife&#39;s Birthday. My wife let the waiter know that she had a severe gluten allergy and ordered a GF shrimp and pasta dish. After 45 minutes waiting for the food, her food came with breaded Shrimp. We sent it back and the waiter apologized and said the pasta and sauce was GF but the chef made a mistake and dipped the shrimp in breadcrumbs. He took it back and showed up 10 minutes later with a new dish and said this is totally GF. Well, 5 minutes later the Manager comes over with the real GF dish and apologizes as the dish she was eating was NOT GF free. She got really sick from this meal. Unbelievable! Never going back.

This place is horrible I honestly don&#39;t understand why people come and eat here, if you look through the glass mirror you can honestly see the managers and servers eating and touching your food with their bare hands and then letting it be served to you after they had their little bite of it. Disgusting don&#39;t even bother to waste your time here.
Awesome !!!!!!!salted caramel cheesecake is the bomb yaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaasssssssssssss I love it hereeeeee. I will go back foreverrrrrr. Yasssssss

I contacted Cheesecake Factory about my review 21 days ago and still haven&#39;t received a call back... very disappointing and another reason why I won&#39;t return. Following up with customers is key especially when working in the customer service industry.

We like the place but the hidden charges are really petty <br>Ordered a burger kids meal and salmon with a slice of cheese cake spent over $50 for lunch <br>The kids meal comes with a drink he opted for cranberry juice but was charged $4 for it when asked for the drink that. Are with the kids meal was told we could not get that since the bill was closed out

Good food with a very good ambient. They have vegetarian options that can make you think twice before ask for a meat meal in your next visit to the place (is really good!) Also, deserts in this place could be an amazing dream, really. The cheesecake it&#39;s really good with the right amount of sweetens and can always make you wish for another one.

The service here tonight was awful. We requested a booth, waited 40 minutes to be shown to a table, and then told that we would have to wait all over again for a booth. <br><br>Next we asked for bread, it didn&#39;t come. The waitress told us that she was waiting for it to come out of the oven even though I saw at least 4 other servers taking bread to tables.<br><br>My food came out wrong twice.  I asked for a menu to order cheesecake and she ignored me only bringing a menu for my dining companion. <br><br>Usually the service is good here. The manager seems to be overwhelmed on a busy might

My mom enjoyed a delicious lunch here yesterday while passing through the area! The service and food were both very good.<br><br>My mom ordered the Tuscan chicken; the vegetables were very fresh and the dish was seasoned delicately but well. I got Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta (gluten free) and it was also very nice. It could have had slightly bolder flavors, but was fresh and good. I&#39;ve had salads at Cheesecake Factory before and they are good, too. <br><br>The service was great and the waiters were very accommodating of food allergies. The decor was a bit over-the-top fancy for me, but chairs were comfortable and the rooms looked good in its style.<br><br>If we&#39;re in Trumbull again, we will go back!

Splain me this Lucy..... how does one have happy hour but doesn&#39;t have drink specials even though they are advertised on your website?? There is no happy in happy hour without discounted libations. Shame on you Cheesecake Factory for false advertising and blaming inability to discount your drinks on the mall. Your saving grace and extra star is because of your food and ONLY the brown bread. Looks like we will be frequenting west Hartford for any future excursions.

Just like every other Cheesecake Factory. Nothing special but still a decent place. The servings are huge which at least makes up for the prices. The restaurant is always very busy (long wait times) and very loud.  It&#39;s attached to the mall and the back wall of the restaurant looks out into the mall. Not a fan of this since it&#39;s usually the area that people wait and I feel pressured to eat faster. <br><br>The seating also kind of sucks. They did everything they could to get every possible space occupied which means your sitting right next to strangers. <br><br>Overall food is ok but I really hate how cramped it is.

I have been to The Cheesecake Factory of Trumbull many times, and each time is always a great experience. Generally, the service is good. The food portions are generous. The lunch specials are good price and you still get a generous amount of food! Every time I go for lunch I get fettuccini and my friend gets the four cheese pasta, which are both very tasty and filling! They start you with two types of bread, and since me and my friend love the brown bread we always ask for more and they have no problem getting you more. I recommend the Godiva Cheesecake, although they all look good. My friend always get the Reese&#39;s or red velvet, which are also both good.

This place has something for everybody and it is a great place for a multi generational party, as in a graduation. I like the salads, the boys do the burgers, and my mother in-law gets the seared Ahi tuna. The place gets busy so the service is hit or miss and they don&#39;t take reservations. But I have found that the food is reliably good. And  the deserts! Mon dieu! The major problem is picking one. We had a graduation party of right and we each got a different cheesecake, then shared. My favorite was the Dulche de leche caramel cheesecake. Worth the poundage.

Seemingly in an effort to maximize square footage and maximize every last cent of revenue, this Cheesecake Factory location installed an &#34;outdoor&#34; patio, complete with wicker dining furniture, umbrellas, and faux plant life. The catch? It&#39;s not outside. It&#39;s in the mall causeway. <br><br>Nothing like the smells and sounds of bustling suburban retail along with the bright antiseptic glow of fluorescent lighting to accompany a fine meal. <br><br>They&#39;ve really redefined &#34;al fresco&#34;. How progressive.<br><br>We came to Cheesecake Factory to spend a gift card. My memories of Cheesecake Factory were mostly on the positive side. A large, mostly competent menu of items at a slightly higher quality level than Applebee&#39;s or Chili&#39;s, in a space slightly more adorned with high ceilings and a templatized attempted at ornate. <br><br>But that&#39;s just it. This is faux fine dining, just as the patio was faux outdoor dining. It&#39;s all a ruse until you eat the food. And I guess the average mall goer that stumbles in here leaves impressed, at least judging by the long waits. But maybe it&#39;s just the effect of marketing, decor, the illusion of &#34;fancy&#34;.<br><br>The sad thing is, for the prices you pay here you can eat at a much more competent, honest, locally owned restaurant. The food and service will likely be better, and you&#39;ll be supporting a local business. But while much better local restaurants struggle on a Sunday night, this place was booming. <br><br>When we asked to be moved from the stale air of the then-closed mall corridor, the staff seemed annoyed. But here&#39;s the thing: it&#39;s customary to ask if you have a preference between outdoor and indoor before being seated, even if the outdoor space is fake.<br><br>Service was satisfactory, but did not match the formal attire that servers don. <br><br>The food was very disappointing all around. The allegedly spicy Louisiana Chicken Pasta was bland, with dry breaded chicken. The Chicken Enchiladas tasted nothing like Mexican food, almost as if they were topped with canned tomato sauce with a sickly sweet taste we couldn&#39;t place. Everything tasted clearly reheated, further proven by the too-hot-to-touch plate of the enchiladas. These taste like frozen microwave entrees, in huge portions, carefully plated. The menu tries to be everything for everyone with hundreds of items, serving the &#34;Factory&#34; moniker well, but one must wonder how much of it is successful. <br><br>The cheesecake with strawberries was the one positive, but our enthusiasm waned when we realized the center was frozen.<br><br>And that dinner perfectly sums up the proposition of Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s all presentation, and from a financial standpoint, it works. <br><br>You just have to wonder from the fake patio and frozen cheesecake whether they care that we can now see the strings.

This is my third time in a Cheesecake Factory, and my first time at this location. I have to say that I don&#39;t really care for it. We waited about an hour to get a table on a Friday night. The food was okay. I tried to order somewhat healthy and got the skinnylicious chicken tacos. They were just okay. The cheesecake is pretty good, but to me it&#39;s not at all worth the hype and long wait.

went there last night.  If you like eating in a noisy place with slow service then this is the place for you.  After waiting about 45 minutes for our meals the manager comes over to explain that our food went to another table and he would make it right.  Not really.  Did nothing.<br>The wait staff conveniently forgot to stop by regularly except to tell us once that our food was being plated.  food didn&#39;t show, then the manager did. .<br>Dish was OK but it was supposed to have a cream sauce but seemed to have a butter sauce.  dripping in it.  I guess in their effort to get food to us eventually the chef forgot about the sauce.  We had a gift card that we needed to use, otherwise would have walked out.

It was really good, but the chicken Madeira had no sauce on it. It had cheese, asparagus and potatoes which were very good, yummy and lots of them. And the chicken was good but there was no Marsala wine sauce! My daughter got the New York cheesecake with strawberries on top and I got the Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Bar cheesecake. And my daughter got the shrimp scampi and salmon combo meal. It was still delicious.

Long waiting-line to get a table. Their entrees were average, but &#34;OMG&#34;, their cheesecakes were DELICIOUS, especially the key lime cheesecake.<br><br>Just order your cheesecakes to go, it is the best solution.

Went here on a Friday night for a birthday dinner. This Friday was typically slower then any other Friday because it was Halloween. I was expecting a long wait as in my prior visits however we were seated as soon as we entered. <br><br>The waitress took a while before coming over to the table to greet us and when she came over she seemed as though she was annoyed and did not want to be here. On the bright side the inside of the restaurant is very nice. <br><br>The bread here is amazing and always fresh. We ordered the crispy calamari as an appetizer which was excellent and as a main dish I had the Orange Chicken which came with white rice which wasn&#39;t bad. Had a different taste then the normal orange chicken I&#39;m accustomed to from local Chinese restaurants. I usually order The crispy chicken costoletta which is always THE BEST. Also have had the Oreo cheesecake and the cookie dough cheesecake both of which are mouth watering!! <br><br>Huge portions so come here on an empty stomach. You&#39;ll still end up taking some home whether it&#39;s the desert or part of your meal.  <br><br>Overall service sucked but food &amp; desert is amazing!

Service to say the least is horrible<br><br>Waited almost 20 minutes for our buffalo blast which were cooked way to long.....<br><br>Ask for water 10 minutes ago, still waiting.<br><br>The floors are beyond slippery they must mop with old grease. <br><br>Are waiter was friendly(just super slow)<br><br>I&#39;ve been to this chain from whiteplains new York to Miami Florida and never had an issue, try it once 5 minutes away from home and it horrible.<br><br>This review will be sent to there Corporate office asap, with more extensive details.<br><br>I would NOT recommend this place to anyone.<br><br>Ruby Tuesday next door has much better service.<br><br>Bad bad bad choice

I wish I have better things to say about this location. I came here around 530 to pick up 2 slices of cake to go. You&#39;d think that&#39;s simple enough for me to get. It&#39;s now 6:00 and I&#39;m still waiting on two simple slices of cheesecake. <br><br>I know this review doesn&#39;t speak for the quality of food here. But this inefficiency needs to be worked on. All the employees don&#39;t have the support and training they need and look more flustered than actually getting the work done properly. <br><br>I hate leaving bad reviews especially since my moms been wanting to come here for some time now, and yet this will be the first and most long lasting memory she has of this store.

Horrible!! we order the fried fish dinner, all the fish but one was empty batter, and that one, my boyfriend got sick on it.<br><br>The customer service??...horrible, when we told her about the no fish, just batter, Emilee just smiled and said, sorry!! <br><br>too bad there was a no star rating.

Cheesecake Factory in general serves great amazing food.   White planes and this one in Trumbull mall are great.   I wouldn&#39;t recommend the Stamford one.     But as for this Trumbull mall branch. I&#39;ve been here twice so far and I highly recommend.   Great service both times. And excellent food as well.   I will definitely go back

I always have the absolute worst service whenever I go to the Cheesecake Factory in Trumbull. Food is so good, but the service sucks! Most of the servers are very rude. Last night, my server came to my table maybe twice the entire night. We also waited over 45 minutes when the hostess told us we&#39;d be waiting for 15-20. I keep trying this place again but can&#39;t seem to catch a break. Very unfortunate.
My friend and I came here and ordered the filet mignon with mash potatoes and esparagus and it was amazing!!! The service the young lady provided us was amazing too and everything was just on point.

I&#39;ve been to this CheeseCake Factory location before and usually its fine. I went in for dinner last night with 2 other people and was so unimpressed. First of all, the hostess working was rude and lazy. When 3 people walk into a restaurant at 8pm on a Wednesday, there shouldn&#39;t be a wait. But there was. Not sure why since MORE THAN HALF of the tables were empty! We waited about 5 minutes for a table, not sure why. Then finally when the hostess of the year decided to seat us outside, she suggested we sat at a table right next to the door, which we didn&#39;t want, so I asked her if we could sit at one of the cushioned booths instead, and she said yes but it would take 5 minutes to bus the table. I thought she was kidding! Lets be serious, the restaurant was essentially half empty, you&#39;re telling me that no one can clean the table? Why couldn&#39;t the hostess do it? I understand that they tip out a busboy to do such things but in a restaurant, the entire FOH staff should come together and bus the dirty tables especially when they restaurant is dead! I&#39;ve worked in restaurants in the past as a hostess, server, and bartender, and NEVER in my life would I tell a customer that they had to wait 5 minutes after already waiting, for a table that can be cleaned in about 30 seconds. But whatever, who cares about hospitality anyway!<br><br>Our server was nice and helpful, although we felt rushed at the end of our meal. <br><br>The food was BLAH.<br>I had the Shrimp and Sausage pasta, and the taste was good. However there was only 3 pieces of shrimp and about 20 pieces of sausage. Literally, I counted. My mother had some chicken teriyaki dish which she absolutely hated.<br><br>The cheesecake was the best part of the evening. 5 stars for dessert. 1 star for the lazy hostess. 3 stars for the server.
So This was an OK experience for my first time at the cheese cake factory. The service was outstanding but it was kinda overrated

I ordered the chicken pot pie from here via grubhub, when it got here it was already cold but i can always heat it up so that wasn&#39;t the issue. I open the container and there are three TINY bite size pieces of chicken- not chicken breast mind you but nugget sized pieces. 3 in a chicken pot pie, surely there must be a mistake.<br><br>Grubhub calls them and they say nope we aren&#39;t refunding it, not our fault. This is beyond disappointing to me, if i order a meal i expect to have it properly made and to treat your customers with dignity and to apologize for the mishap. Whoever was the manager that day seriously needs to learn better customer service and to look over their kitchen manager/staff better to ensure the meals going out are actually up to par and filled correctly.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a place for good food and dessert. Never a let down. Just by myself for one glass of wine and a chicken and mash potato dinner, the cost was 28 dollars and change. Was it worth the price to come back often? No, the prices are about 3-4 dollars extra for entrees and 2 dollars extra on glasses of wine. Otherwise I would be a regular here at the Cheesecake Factory. I have them 4 out of 5 stars because their food is great, but just a bit pricey for middle class standards.

This was our 2nd time at the Trumbull location. Very short wait to get a table, our waiter was fantastic! We had Thai lettuce wraps that were very good but for a $13 appetizer they were cheap on the chicken and sauces.Bang Bang chicken and shrimp was very good. Chicken picotta was very good. We complained to the waiter on the large amount of ice in our marguerita&#39;s and the small little glass , we each drank 4  because they were so small. Godiva cheesecake was oh so good! Sorry Cheesecake Factory you only get 3 stars for being cheap with the chicken and excessive ice in your drinks.
The food was good.<br>The employees are fantastic.<br>The wait was long but it&#39;s in a mall and it was a weekend so you kinda get whatever you get.

I would like to start of with saying that their food is always amazing! It&#39;s always what you expect and if not, better. With that being said, the service is HORRIBLE! Idk if it&#39;s just the service on the patio or what. I always sit on the patio. We had appetizers, which were amazing. While we were eating our appetizers, our entrees came out. They should&#39;ve timed it better. My veggie burger was supposed to come with a salad. You would think that my salad would come out first or at least at the same time as my burger. It came out about 5 minutes after my burger came out. It was irritating. And the waitress&#39;s phone kept ringing and she didn&#39;t even notice. And we had to keep asking for refills on our water. This might just be a patio thing, but I&#39;m not sure. I love their food and vegan options, but get so irritated with the service. This happens every time.

If you want to be treated poorly for overpriced food, this is the place for you. The one star is for the hope that their customer service gets better. I went in with a party of 4 (there were only two other groups there and they weren&#39;t groups of 4). The manager said 15-20 minutes so we kindly waited with the buzzer by the inner door. We proceeded to wait and when my buzzer went off 25 minutes later I went up and the hostess said we were buzzed 20 minutes ago (which I had in my hand the entire time and didn&#39;t go off). Even if it did my name was never said out loud like the other parties present. The hostess then informed us that we would be the next 4 seated. We also overheard the manager say to the hostess to not seat us. We waited for another 5 minutes and another 4 person group was called before us that just got there. At that point we decided that no matter how much people like cheesecake there is no excuse for poor customer service and we left. There&#39;s a Panera Bread down the hall that we went to instead, much nicer people and better food.

Often enjoy going here for lunch and sitting at the bar. Always have amazing service and an experience here. The food is great and portioned just enough to have a significant meal. While it can be a bit pricey, it is still great food and drinks. My only concern would be there is no wifi and apple pay. Interesting that there can be such a great place that is behind with technology.
Too large of a restaurant for Trumbull <br>Empty tables everywhere but still 30 minutes to sit

Long lines. I went there and enjoyed the beet and goat cheese salad which was pretty good. The cheese cake was good. Nothing great. <br><br>Second and third time I&#39;ve gone, I got food poisoning. <br>I refuse to get anything other than drinks or cheesecake there now. <br><br>Nothing I had there was worth the price and the menu is the size of a novel. Nothing is fresh. <br>Not a fan.

TCF is always good, albeit expensive.  Consistent with something for everyone as well as the cheesecakes and dessert.  This is a new, small location opened 8/5 and it&#39;s clear they are being careful with service (buddy training) and food taking longer than usual but service is attentive as you would and should expect at this price point.<br><br>Oh and like most CAKE&#39;s I have been too long lines are guaranteed unless you go before 4:30 for dinner.<br><br>I look forward to a more quieter Sunday brunch starting at 10am...<br><br>A solid 3.5; if service faster 4....
I genuinely felt like I was never ripped off more than on my first and last visit to this place.  Service was mediocre at best and food was about the same as a fast food place.

The least busy day of the week on a Monday, you&#39;ll find yourself waiting over one hour and counting for the meal to come. I&#39;m disgusted by how all the employees take their job slowly as if its okay for customers to wait 30 minutes for water or over a hour for food to be served on the table.

First let me say that I do love Cheesecake Factory but NOT this one!! Trumbull Mall has the worst one I ever been to. The Service was terrible but lets get to the food situation. I ordered the Shrimp scampi which was bland with barely any taste. My wife order the Jamaican black pepper shrimp which they forgot the plantains!! Then the waiter said sorry and went to put the order in, they NEVER came out, he came back to us 3 times asking if they came and each time was NO they didn&#39;t. Her dish was also bland and shrimp overcooked. Please avoid this particular Cheesecake Factory unless you want bland food and ok service!!

Worse experience everrr!! To begin with I told the server this was our first time coming to the cheesecake factory. The wait was not long but everything else was! We waited so so long for our drink , butter, and the longest for our food which came out over cooked and cold as a brick. I asked for new fries and they brought me out more cold fries!!! I asked for warm potatoes which were suppised to be mashed and the manager brought me them with chunks of potatoes in them. The manager didn&#39;t even introduce him self! Waited another 20 minutes for them to remake my meal by then everyone was done with their food! Would never go here again or reccomend it to anyone! Only gave one star because I couldn&#39;t do no star!

This chain restaurant is located in a busy mall. There is very ample and very comfortable seating inside as well as a small outdoor patio dining area which is nice. The décor and the overall ambiance gives this place an upscale feel and the entire staff is friendly and attentive. But while the place has an upscale look and vibe, it is really just your average chain restaurant with good PR. However, that good PR makes their prices a bit steeper than places like an Applebee&#39;s or Ruby Tuesday&#39;s. The appetizers here average around $10.50 and the main dishes around $19.00. For two people each ordering an appetizer, main dish, beverage and one dessert to split, you can easily drop $60-$75 per person before the tip. If you order alcohol, jack that price up much higher.<br><br>As for the food itself. Let&#39;s start with the menu. It is 20 pages long! You have so much to choose from the decision is staggering. I have been there half a dozen times and tried something different each time. At that rate it may well take a few hundred visits to put even a dent in the menu. Whatever you&#39;re in the mood for, you can find something here.<br><br>The quality of the food is good to very good. The preparation and presentation are excellent. The portions are a bit on the smallish side compared to other chains, especially when you consider the price, but they are still enough to enjoy adequately, though you will have room for dessert (that may be the point).<br><br>Some negatives, if you go at peak days/times, you might have quite a wait, it could be an hour. I have only had a wait on one trip, it was 25 minutes. Another inconsistency is the prep time to get your meal. I have had a meal arrive anywhere from 15 minutes to over 35 minutes from the time of ordering, and it did not seem to matter if the place was busy or not with the longer waits.<br><br>Now let&#39;s get to the part where this place simply shines; the desserts! As their name implies, this place has the most amazing and decadent selection of cheesecakes you can possibly imagine, and then some. A full three pages of the menu is dedicated to their cheesecakes, specialty desserts, specialty coffees, iced and frozen drinks ice cream creations and shakes. If you have a sweet tooth, you will think you have died and gone to sugar heaven! And the prices are very reasonable, much more so than their regular menu items, averaging $7.50 per item. You can also buy whole cheesecakes from their display cases.<br><br>The dessert portions are generous too. One piece of cheesecake is more than enough for one person, and can be split between two and still give each of you enough to enjoy. I love cheesecake in general and this place makes them an art. I have had theirs on three of my trips, though I am not normally one for dessert.<br><br>Bottom line is the food is on average, very good, the portions a bit smallish, but if you include dessert, you will not leave hungry. The service from the staff is excellent and the desserts exceptional. They are quite pricey on the food and beverages for a chain retaurant, but great on the desserts. The wait times to be seated or served are hit and miss. If it were up to me alone, I would only go here for the desserts and have my meal at another, less costly chain, but my girlfriend loves the place and she&#39;s worth the extra cost.

45 minutes for 2 half-loaves of cold, hard bread!! Let&#39;s just start there.<br><br>Now that I got that out, I have to say that I really tried my hardest to give our waiter all of the patience I could muster up while serving us, but he just couldn&#39;t cut it. Beside the bread (did I mention that it took 45 minutes!?), the COMPLETELY uncooked rice (rolling around on the plate), and complete disregard for my extravagant request to help me celebrate my sister&#39;s birthday (while exactly 9 other poorly executed &#34;happy birthday&#34; numbers rang out), I graciously allotted two stars to this place because they managed to get my Chicken Costoletta right.....for the most part.
The service is ALWAYS SLOW! Even on an empty day when there are a ton of employees wandering about, maybe a kitchen issue?! Never going back, just a waste of time.

I went into the restaurant with my colleague and I was not greeted by anyone I had to search and find a hostess. Once I found her she then told me I needed to wait for a runner to then come and seat me. She had a horrible attitude she asked me what was my name I asked her if they were on a wait she stated no it&#39;s just for the runner to call us. The runner then appeared and I saw the hostess tell her not to come over to us to let us come to have us come over to her. I then walked over and asked where was the manager. The woman who I had approach had a very bad demeanor. As I&#39;m speaking to her she&#39;s waving her hands in my face telling me that nothing wrong happened and she was standing right there which was not true. I then stated to her I wasn&#39;t complaining in regards to the hostess I&#39;m complaining in regard to the way that we were treated when it was time to be seated. She then calls my friend and I a nigger  and said why are you people always upset. And from her prior comment about us being niggers I&#39;m assuming you people is in reference to us being black. This woman was very rude to be a manger.She also allowed other restaurant employees to be involved in the conversation and they were laughing and egging it on.A guy walked by who identified himself as a manager he was speaking a bunch of slang and I asked him not to address us in that manner. He then got an attitude and said he was calling security because I asked him for the number to corporate. This place is horrible and everyone needs to be replaced at this point.

The food was subpar although my major complaint is that my food came out late in comparison to the other diners at my table due to waiting error. The way the manager compensated with the 20 minute error was by giving me a free piece of cheesecake. Management conducted the incident quite well, although the waitress was not the best. If you are thinking of coming here I suggest having an enormous amount of patience.

Ordered takeout on their website. Arrived at curbside pick up and called multiple times, no one picked up. Went into bakery to pick up order and gentleman could not have cared less. He was very unfriendly. Also, they did not provide silverware or napkins in the take out bag. The third star is for the food, which was quite good but would&#39;ve been easier to eat with utensils.

The desserts stand out more than their menu items. I usually order the red velvet cheesecake which is always perfect- slices of moist red velvet cake wedged between smooth cheesecake. <br><br>The last time I ordered a burger, the meat was dry and the Mac and cheese that comes with it was crumbly and mushed together. The vegetable tempura &#34;fries&#34; was delicious though. If anything stick to their pasta.<br><br>The service at this location is just like any other Cheesecake Factory- long wait time and even longer service time.

Always a fan of this place. It&#39;s smaller than other CCF&#39;s I have been to but none the less its the real deal. Staff is super nice, and its better than going to weschester to get some amazing cheese cake. <br><br>Fav Dish: Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp<br>Fav Cheese Cake: Bananna.

Near disaster coming in the door. However the professionalism shown by the manager Jonathan and great service by our server Tara saved the evening. As always food outstanding. Will continue to be a happy and repeat customer!
Horrible service. We actually had to walk out of the restaurant. I usually love the Cheesecake Factory but never go to this location again.

The food was great and plentiful. Service was friendly, but sooooooo incredibly slow. 25 minutes after ordering before the first kid&#39;s drink arrive. 10 more minutes before the next 2 were delivered. (If you&#39;re a mom, you know this is not Ok...)<br><br>We preordered the birthday cheesecake earlier in the day so it would be ready after dinner. We finished dinner, requested our cakes, and it took an additional 40 minutes before they brought the cakes out for us to sing happy birthday. It was unsliced, so they brought it back to the kitchen and 10 minutes later we were final having dessert. <br><br>This was on a Monday night. I can&#39;t fathom how bad it is on the weekend.<br><br>I know lots of people enjoy The Cheescake Factory, but it&#39;s just not for me. Give yourself at least 2.5-3 hours if you plan to eat here.

They mess up my order every single time, it is literally never correct. I do not know why because I order the same thing every time and it is one of their &#34;specialties&#34;. Worst Cheesecake Factory location in all CT. UPDATE: ordered out again today this time getting sliders. Asked for plain no ketchup no onion, what do I get? Both on it and don&#39;t realize until I get home. Buns soggy and Also the fries tasted like they were made at lunch time. So disgusting. Don&#39;t know how this location is still open.

The service can&#39;t be worse. Yesterday I went to this Cheesecake Factory, I didn&#39;t need to wait for seating but the service is too bad and slow. It took like one hour to wait. We even didn&#39;t have knives and forks when the servicer giving the food. Also, the food wasn&#39;t fresh at all. I have to ask the manager to change. It was a really bad birthday experience. Won&#39;t be here again.
Terrible service. Slow night and very slow service. Drinks and food took forever. Food came out at different times and it was obvious that some meals were under a heat lamp drying out the pasta.
Very good bartenders there. I work in the mall so i go there weekends it so much fun to have ur nachos and best drinks. Love it

Where do I begin . The hostess from last night was extremely rude . She told us 15 minutes and when I went to ask her how much longer she snapped back with &#34; I told you it would be a half hour &#34; she definitely didn&#39;t and was so rude about it  . Service is extremely sssssslllllloooowwww . Took forever to get our drinks and food . Only thing that came quickly was the check .  Also , I went to use the restroom and the floor from my table to the bathroom was so extremely greasy feeling I had to pay attention to walking so I didn&#39;t slip . The bathroom looked like a bomb exploded in it . TP all over the bathroom stall and pee on the seat :( so Nasty . Food was good but poor customer service and poor sanitation will keep us away .

My boyfriend and I went for dinner tonight to celebrate our one year anniversary. Everything was going well until I took a bite of cheesecake and pulled a long white hair from my mouth because it was in the cheesecake!!!! It was brought to the waiters attention without asking us he brought a piece of the same cheesecake eww!!! My boyfriend told him we didn&#39;t want it anymore and they brought us the check. It was over $70! We asked if something could be done since I almost ate the hair and it went into my mouth! All they did was take off our drinks which were both Cokes so they only took off about $4... really? I almost ate a piece of a strangers hair that was in their product and that&#39;s all they do? We will not be returning. I hope this review helps

Ok tonight I was very dissapointed in the Ccf my fries was cold as well as my sliders luke warm I sent the fries back delt with the chicken. My dinner mate came out with no sause on her pasta then after she ate what she could and opt to take her food home the waiter throw it away. They comp the cheese cake but it wasn&#39;t the cheese cake that got thrown away <br>Very dissapointed tonight

I&#39;ve been to the cheesecake factory many times in different states.  I enjoy the food and desserts.  However for such a busy and well established company you would think this establishment would have the option to make reservations for large parties.  I came with a large party (13 plus)  after 6pm and had to wait 30 minutes to get seated.  This could have been avoided had the option to make reservations been available.  This is totally unacceptable and unprofessional, how can such a big chain no accept reservation at mall location where it&#39;s extremely business.
Delusions fast clean friendly staff how ever s little crowded due to it being in the mall.

The server asked how we liked our meal. My response was &#34;not worth a two hour wait.&#34;<br><br>We were a party of six who ate there early on the Saturday evening before Thanksgiving, in order, we hoped, to beat the dinner rush. Surprise - we had a long hour&#39;s wait to get a table, then what seemed like an intolerably long time from when when we ordered until our food was presented.<br><br>When one of the others at the table echoed my comment to the manager, who had come over with our server, she told us when we checked in, when we were seated... <br><br>All our friend wanted was an acknowledgement that we had had a long wait, and a small symbol of that acknowledgement - something like coffee for the table.<br><br>But as every practiced politician knows, and as everyone whose job is customer service should know, when you&#39;re arguing process you&#39;re losing.<br><br>My wife and I both had salads. Our food was good enough that we would return. But only if the wait is short - 15 minutes or less - or of we planned to shop during our wait (would that there were a Barnes &amp; Noble, the best place to kill time in any mall). The keeper of the list takes cell phone numbers, so why hang around in the cow pen inside the door?<br><br>Good food and one star may seem an oxymoron. The issue is that those who run this 300 seat restaurant would do themselves a favor to find a a way to make frustrated guests happy, at least as long as it remains a novelty.

This is the Cheesecake Factory, and they ran out of the Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake...<br><br>Also, my friend&#39;s plate was hotter than the food. Not impressed. Over priced food for a mass amount of mediocre food. This restaurant is located in a mall, stop trying to be more than that.
The food is horrible, ordered well done hamburger with  mushrooms and it was raw.  Mushrooms were horrible  too.

Came in on my lunch break because I&#39;m working a double shift. I was by myself and was really looking forward to their bacon cheeseburger. They sat me down and not one employee came to even give me bread or water. I waited 10 mins and still nothing. Ended up leaving and getting my lunch elsewhere. Not very good service.
The Cheesecake Factory was a beautiful experience. It was my first time at the one here in Trumbull. Service was courteous and timely .

Wow. Where do I Start... I really enjoy my visits to The Cheesecake Factory but this one takes the cake (no pun intended). We haven&#39;t even left the restaurant yet and I felt compelled to leave this review. <br><br>We were a party of 8 and I get that we would have to wait for a bit. It turned out to be almost an hour and a half wait to get seated. It was my room mates niece&#39;s birthday. It all went downhill from there. First off they did not have the appetizers that we ordered. Second, besides the 1 1/2 we waited to get seated we had to wait almost another 45 minutes before the main course came out. We went in for lunch around 1 and did not start to eat till after 3pm. At this point we were starving. Here is the kicker. Despite our best efforts to tell the wait staff that we had a birthday person at the table, of everyone&#39;s main course, they bought her&#39;s out cold!! Needless to say we were not a happy bunch. The waitress did her best to apologize and the manager comp&#39;d her meal but that was not the point. They ruined what was supposed to be a memorable occasion. Her 21st birthday. <br><br>Some of us lost our appetite because everyone mood changed. For the worse. Good thing I don&#39;t ever have to come back here...

The waitress said they didn&#39;t have the ingredients to make 2 different things I ordered. Are you kidding me?So I ordered something I didn&#39;t really want. The food was terrible. Rice wasn&#39;t cooked all the way. The staff are either to young or inexperienced to provide the quality of service I&#39;ve had at other The Cheesecake Factory locations. The restroom toilet was broken with parts of it in the toilet bowl.  This is the ghettoest cheesecake factory I&#39;ve ever been too. The waitress was nice. She tried so I left her a big tip but I&#39;ll never be back.

I worked at the Lake Grove location for four years and realized the most important part of the job was to never let a guest see what mess goes on behind closed doors. This location has only been open for about a month so there are a bunch of kinks to work out, but I definitely could see the issues all around me. Empty drinks, m is - running of food, servers not visiting their tables enough to check in....Obviously I&#39;ve worked at this restaurant before and put my service above everyone&#39;s....well it is. I&#39;m too bias so I should probably stop reviewing.

Very disappointed in my visit at The Cheesecake Factory tonight. Ordered coke with no ice, waitress brings out coke with ice. Make a remark, she doesn&#39;t volunteer to fix it. When I finish it, she asks if I want a refill and I say, with NO ice this time please. Brings another one with ice. When our steaks came out, ordered medium well, they are rare. It takes an additional 20 minutes for them to pop them in the microwave. During this time frame, flies were continuously flying around our table. The restaurant was probably 1/5 filled, I have no idea why it took over an hour and a half for us to be served and why our waitress could not understand basic orders.
Love the cheesecakes but the menu is also great.  The cobb salad was amazing.  Very busy on the weekends but one of the few places worth waiting for a table.  Service was friendly and efficient.

A couple of months ago, my husband and I were in the Trumbull Mall and decided to try the Cheesecake Factory for lunch.  We liked it so much that we&#39;ve been back twice.  I&#39;ve never been a fan of chain restaurants, but we found the food to be well made, delicious, and the staff helpful and friendly. The place is absolutely spotless and inviting. I&#39;ve had a couple of different salads, and enjoyed them all.  My husband had the salmon today (I don&#39;t recall what he&#39;s had in the past) and found it delicious -- even better than a $32 salmon he had the other evening in a fancy restaurant in Westport.  We had &#34;lunch-sized&#34; portions, but they were big enough for dinner.  My only complaint is that the gorgeous cakes they have on display have about 1200 calories per slice -- much too much for this diet-conscious person.  They were tempting, but I had to resist.  Next time I&#39;m there, I won&#39;t torture myself by looking at them.

This place is brand new for our area, so we tried it. The decor and sound level reminded me of a Las Vegas casino! We were glad outdoor seating was available, where it was a little quieter, even if we were basically sitting in the mall parking lot. (Also, tubs of aromatic garbage rolled past every half hour or so, being taken from kitchen outlet to refuse receptacle.) <br>The staff is trained but very young and inexperienced and seemed overwhelmed -- the menu is vast and communication among bar, kitchen, servers, and all are still chaotic. Our waiter was very sweet and the slowness was clearly not his fault. Food was well prepared and tasty. We were too full to eat cheesecake but brought some home with us. <br>By 6pm there was a line out the door, so most people must know and appreciate the chain. It was too crazy for us old folks (51, 53, 56, and 61), and I doubt we will return even when they&#39;re running smoothly.

Wow it was busy sunday afternoon 3:00 but we were only two so got a table fairly quick. Workers were hustling and bustling! Our server was running around here and there but brought our water and bread quickly. We ordered edimame for app and two salads and literally all came same time. My salad was a special shrimp salad and lettuce was pretty but didnt look washed. It was dark and I was hungry so ate most of it anyway. Server never came to check if all was ok-just kept rushing around. Understandable but dont expect a quiet relaxing meal with attention on the weekend. Idk if its like that during the week. The menu was extensive. There is something for everyone. I probably wont be back any time soon.

The food is inexpensive in my opinion for the portion size which you are getting. The best thing about the Cheesecake Factory at this location is the convenience. If there is a long wait (which there usually never is) you can browse the mall and wait for a text. <br><br>Service is pretty fast and accommodating. Only one time did I experience a long wait time and the manager offered an appetizer on the house for my guests and I. Totally worth it. I also love the brunch menu, great bang for not so much bucks.

The cheese cakes are the best. Their food is just okay. Pasta is too greasy. We ordered two dishes for two of us but could not finish at all. The setting is quite new and modern but it smells a little.
As usual,  food was good.  The fried calamari was VERY salty.  Our server was Mylene (spelling),  she was great!  She was Friendly,  polite,  and very competent.  Enjoyed my lunch and service.
So far I enjoy eating here. Very large menu to choose ftom. Here again with jack

Great location, great staff, amazing food. Beautiful decor. Can eat here on a date, with the family, or just for fun! The food is delicious and the cheesecake is to die for. Gets very busy but that&#39;s a good thing.

No wait for two people which was great. Our waiter was friendly, though there was a language barrier. We ordered the artichoke and crab dip that was so salty we couldn&#39;t finish it--way to much old bay; the beet and goat cheese salad was tasty but literally had a single piece of beet on it; and the sweet corn tamale cakes were actually pretty good. We decided not to stay for an entree, left a nice tip and went home. We will not be going back.
The food and service was good. The place looks nice and smells good. The food was a little pricy tho.
Is what it is...nothing too special here. Chain food, slow service and probably seated in the worst booth on the planet. Probably won&#39;t be back, 60$ lunch could have been at a 10x better place.

Let&#39;s just start by saying the sun came out faster than our food. We waited over 45 minutes for three steak sandwiches and a salad. My mother ordered a tea and was still waiting for it while the rest of our party had received their drinks. When the tea finally came, she had to wait longer while we tried to get the waitresses attention who failed to bring a cup or spoon. Although the food was good the service was absolutely horrible. It&#39;s a shame because with good service this chain would rock. Please properly train your staff. Poor<br> service is the demise of a chain.
The service here sucks, haven&#39;t seen our server in 15 mins. And only received 2 of the 3 meals and no silverware yet!!

This will my last time at this location the ladies at the register always have a attitude, one time they forgot to put my order thru and I was on lunch break I had to wait for them to put it through again. I went there again today it took them 45 mins to make pancakes smh never again.

I think they have way too much stuff going on w the menu- The food I ordered seemed like it was something frozen they threw in the microwave and then buried it in too much butter. It&#39;s overpriced in every way . Mixed drinks are weak and watered down for $12.00 each! Won&#39;t go back.

Came here on a busy Saturday afternoon so I expected a bit of a wait however after receiving our drinks and an appetizer along with some really hard bread and almost frozen butter we waited an additional 30 minutes at which point our waitress came over and asked if she could wrap up the remainder of our appetizer to go. Ummm no thanks we haven&#39;t had our entree yet. She looked confused and walked off. Hoping she went to get our entrees, we waited an additional 15 minutes. Finally I spotted her and asked that she cancel our entrees and give us the bill for the appetizer. Again the confusion and she just walked away. 5 more minutes and the Manager came over and asked if we were sure we didn&#39;t want our entrees that it would just be a few more minutes. I explained we had been waiting for 45 minutes and really just needed to leave and go get something to eat at that point. You&#39;d think he would have offered a discount on the entrees, or give us the 7.00 appetizer on the house. Nope. Not sure what the issue was as there were several tables around us that arrived at the same time or minutes after us and had been served within 20 minutes. There were only 2 of us. Anyway there you have it. Hope y&#39;all get better service.

Similar to Noel P, I just waited on hold to place takeout order for 5 minutes, hung up, called back saying that I was on hold for 5, without apology was told they&#39;d get someone, before holding another 5 minutes and hanging up again.  The same thing happened a few months ago before getting lucky on the 3rd try.  Taking phone orders isn&#39;t that hard... this place desperately needs new management.

Went there with my wife Feb 13, thought we would skip the Valentines day crowd. 117 minutes later we get a text. (Yeah 117 minutes after being told a 90 minute wait time) What a disappointment service was slow, food was subpar at best not to mention overpriced. Steak was ordered medium. We got the charred version. We just wanted to get out. My advice... Go somewhere else, avoid the headache.
Not bad ever, love cheese cake factory as it really lovely restaurant. Don not miss teriyaki chicken and cashew chicken.

First visit of the new Trumbull location. Kids are excited as we visit re factory when we visit Florida every year.
