Place was mobbed but they still brought out our good timely and everything was great especially the pear arugula and blue cheese flatbread yum!!!Only complaint was the roast chicken was overlooked and dry. It is a packed Friday night. They they brought the whole table desserts and sincerely apologized. That&#39;s great service and we will be back here many times in the near future.  Laura our server was really great. Very attentive, very nice and well informed. Hope we get her again!!

The Cheesecake Factory is always a good option especially when you are craving sweets. Their food is very good, although sometimes a little pricey, but I always get their famous cheesecake which is worth every penny. Most of the times I have visited here I have just gone with friends and order cheesecake and drinks. I have never had a long wait either (but have only gone during non-busy times) and the staff is always friendly.

Overall unpleasant experience. From the INSANE wait time to the complete lack of attention and bad food. I&#39;m sorry but this is just not a good choice. Please consider that you would be waiting an awful amount of time for a bad experience.

Honestly, I&#39;ve had mixed feelings about this restaurant for a while. Today I came in and the wait staff completely ignored me and party. When I complained about my pasta they made me wait almost an hour and they didn&#39;t fix it. WORST DINING EXPERIENCE EVER!!. I will never eat here again, I personally wouldn&#39;t recommend it.
yo this place was super scary it&#39;s like pitch black u need a flashlight to eat. a very freaky place there&#39;s like serpents all around the lamps and evryones watching you

I&#39;d heard this place was coming &amp; I counted down the days until opening day! As the date drew closer, my friends &amp; I decided we should get a group together to support this great business, that&#39;s new to our locale! So we gathered &amp; headed over to enjoy the famous cheesecakes! <br>OK I know, I know it&#39;s a chain restaurant &amp; they usually have long wait times... &amp; this location is no different in those things, but they also have some good food, servers who want to do their job, &amp; oh FANTASTIC CHEESECAKE!!!! We got here w/our grp,  &amp; we waited a while, but  I spoke w/Mike, &amp; he tried to help us get our large grp in &amp; so while he worked on that, we amused ourselves &amp; other guests while we waited. <br>We had all phenomenally AWESOME GREAT time w/good friends &amp; supreme cheesecake!!!! We didn&#39;t try any of their regular foods,  just deserts. ..all was very good, including service!! We look forward to our next visits individually &amp; together. <br><br>Side Note to Corporation:<br>ONE suggestion to The Cheesecake Factory Corp, while I know they don&#39;t currently take ANY reservations, at ANY OF THEIR LOCATIONS, they SHOULD REALLY CONSIDER accepting reservations for larger groups, at ALL locations. (Or at the very least do a &#34;trial period&#34; of this concept at select spots and see what sort of response they get from both customers, employees,  &amp; sales). They could call, email, and/or text also, to confirm the details, so as to avoid no shows etc. I think this would encourage more business for them &amp; happy customers overall. I had no issues for this visit, but just think that for the business, the community, &amp; all in general, it&#39;d be something they would be wise to consider. Just a thought!  :)

Pretty interesting first time experience at the Cheesecake Factory.  I felt like I was in Las Vegas at a buffet with the design of the resturant and the huge diversity of culture. The place was absolutely packed yet service was still very good, even from the trainee Leon, who may have been better than our actual waitress. But now writing this review, when it comes down to it, it was still just mass produced chain restaurant food. Huge menu, great service, just didn&#39;t have that homemade feel.

This poor rating is reflective of the drink prices not being posted in the menu. Wow, what a shock when the bill came. Really disappointed that the restaurant would intentionally mislead it&#39;s customers just to make an extra buck. Too bad because the food and service was ok. They lost a customer today....

Seated and waited on promptly. The waitress was nice. We ordered 2 orders of the filet mignon both were supposed to be cooked med but we&#39;re well done with the burnt taste ruining them both but mashed potatoes were good. Also ordered the Chicken Madeira with Steak Diane combo. The steak was good and cooked correct but the chicken was disgusting, it tasted exactly like a burnt omelette. The mashed potatoes were good. I would not return.
Wouldn&#39;t take Samsung pay (credit card via phone) or wouldnt take my credit card numbers, had to be a physical card. Just lost a customer.

Ugh where do I begin!? THE WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!Stopped by for a &#34;supposed to be quick lunch&#34; while me and my friend were shopping at the mall. Ended up being almost 2 HOURS from start to finish. Once inside we did notice they were a little busy, but decided to sit down anyways. Went over to the hostess stand and was seated immediately. Afterwards, no one acknowledged us for almost 15 minutes since we sat down. <br><br>While we were waiting for the waiter to come I was already getting frustrated with the fact that there were so many servers passing by and not 1 could say &#34;someone will be right with you&#34;. We should have left right then and there. Anyways, once our server did come, which I don&#39;t even know his name because he never introduced himself, he asked what we wanted to drink. We placed our drink orders and an appetizer, since we were still deciding on the main course. <br><br>Long story short, we waited almost 15 minutes to get our drinks alone, and I had to ask for some bread for the table since we were starving. Once our server left the table he literally stood around and chatted with co workers instead of getting our drinks. <br><br>Then the appetizer arrived which was delivered by another server, and I had to ask that guy for my glass of water which OUR SERVER forgot. About 15 minutes later our  server came by to check on us and I told him we were ready to order our main course, but he took FOREVER to put the order in the computer. We saw him stand around and talk with co workers AGAIN instead of putting our food order in. SERIOUSLY!?  We literally waited another 20 minutes for our main dishes. <br><br>Once we were done eating, we wanted to bring a piece of cheesecake home and get the bill. Again the waiter was ignoring us or just simply forgot to check on us, and kept walking by. Once he did come back to our table we waited another 30 MINUTES to get the check and piece of cheesecake to go! That&#39;s ridiculous!!! I wanted to just get up and leave already but we were waiting for the change. <br><br>I understand it was busy but 2 other tables sat around us and they were helped immediately and received their drinks and checks before us! What kind of s*** is that!? I was getting really ticked off, to the point where I just wanted to get up and leave. <br><br>As far as the food, it was okay.. Nothing special. Definitely won&#39;t be returning unless they fix their service and staff. Hostess was rude and asked me with an attitude to move my dirty dishes from the table next to us so she can seat a party. UM HELLO LADY WE PUT OUR PLATES THERE BECAUSE NO ONE CAME AND REMOVED THEM FROM THE TABLE SO WE HAD NO ROOM TO EAT! <br><br>That was my experience at the Cheesecake Factory in the Trumbull Mall. Unless you have a couple of hours to waste on sitting down and eating here, I would suggest you skip it and go somewhere else!

Service was terrible. There were dozens of empty tables but there was a line to sit, so we grabbed an empty booth in the bar. They took our order and disappeared...for over 45 minutes. Didn&#39;t bring out the salad even before the meal. Finally they brought our meal minus the sides which didn&#39;t arrive until we were done eating. The food was ok, it was just like pulling teeth to get it. They just could not possibly have cared less. Never going back!

After the 30 min wait for our table, we were finally seated. Unfortunately, we didn&#39;t have a waiter even stop by to give water or utensils for at least 20 mins after we sat down. I was with a party of 5 so the time passed as we looked over the menu. I finally got so agitated that I pulled a waiter over to explain that we were waiting for 20 mins without any service. She immediately helped and was very professional and sweet. However, our drinks were lack luster and food could use some more flavor. Waitress was the best part of our dinning experience.

The relatively new outside seating arrangement in front of uniqlo is very nice.  Comfortable chairs.  The Jamaican black pepper shrimp on the menu is a perennial favorite. One bad change to that menu item is the replacement of the mango salsa with pineapple. That&#39;s a big noticeable change for the worse. Being the mango salsa back please

I had an awful experience here and haven&#39;t been back since. The food was not appetizing at all and I had to wait half an hour just to return my dish because the waitress seemed to just disappear. What I can say is that the manager at the time was very helpful and apologized for our experience.

I have eaten there three times now.  My first mistake was going the day after their grand opening.  From the time we were seated thru the time we left...2-1/2 hours had passed and I was more than upset.  Nothing fancy was ordered either plus NO desert.  Food was great but I wouldn&#39;t wait that long gain.<br><br>We waited about 6 weeks to try it again.  I actually ordered the same food.  I was surprised that the food was overly salted which took away from my eating experience. This time we were there just under 2 hours.<br><br>Our third time there was disastrous l, I ordered a special, 1/2 sandwich with cup of soup.  The sandwich couldn&#39;t be held...it just fell apart...<br><br>Our wait person was also servicing a table to our left.  Our tables were too close together...not for our waitress though!  She squeezed herself right in there but her butt was in my face and so was that napkin she had in her back pocket.  That thing moved items on our table plus kept hitting me every time she stood between the tables. <br><br>I was disappointed with every aspect of my meal....I couldn&#39;t wait to get out of this overly noisy environment where the music was was set too high to have any kind of conversation.<br><br>I follow the 3-strike rule....I&#39;m out of there now and for good.  The wait staff have learned bad habits from the get go and now have perfected them to a fault.  Too expensive for a mediocre experience.

I ordered take out here one night while I was in the area. It was by far the worst. Opened up my containers only to have reheated microwaved food. The burger bread was soggy, my rolls were not even crispy and burnt chicken. I immediately called the restaurant to express my dissatisfaction. I love eating from the Cheesecake Factory but that one occasion was a complete turnoff.

The bartenders think that the bar is a dividing wall that customers cannot hear beyond. One asked me if I was waiting for takeout and then turned away (service bartender). Customers don&#39;t wish to be party to their banter while trying to enjoy my dinner and get some work done. The soup was over-seasoned and I sent it back. No apologies from the bartender Phylicia. Thumbs down.
Cheesecake Factory as usual has giant portions of yummy food. The wait is always insane so go before you get hungry. The wait will help you power through your meal and have leftovers for later.

I always have an unpleasant time at this particular Cheesecake Factory. There seem to be many servers, adorned in white and bustling about, but for some reason the service is EXTREMELY slow. My glass of water doesn&#39;t seem get refilled until my waiter is around my table for me to flag him/her down. <br><br>As for the food, it always looks appealing on the menu and even on the warm plate itself... however, the taste is either completely bland or ordinary. For a place that charges the prices that they do for their dishes, I expect more flavor -- or at least something to write home about. But sadly, this is never the case. <br><br>Save your money and spend it elsewhere. You will be much happier if you take my word.

Ordered a meal to go . Said it would be 20 mins. I get there and apparently they gave our food to someone else. Offered free cheesecake which is cute and all ..but doesn&#39;t take away from the fact that I had to wait for another order.  The service at this location is not good. Would rather drive to Danbury than eat here.

Went to The Cheesecake Factory weeks ago with my daughter and her mother on a busy Weekend night. Had a fun experience and our waitress Georgia was very nice and attentive. Great service overall and made us feel very welcome. The food was flavorful as always and the drinks were well made. I&#39;m sure we&#39;ll be visiting again soon.

Last night our family decided to eat at the Cheesecake Factory in Trumbull.  This experience was very disappointing.  We did not mind the 50 minute wait to be seated.  Our server Erma was very attentive and polite.  What was disappointing was the long wait from the time we were seated to the time we received our food.  The quality of the food was horrible.  I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya and had to send it back because the pasta was under cook.  The waitress stated that the manager will come over and speak to us but she never came over.  My niece ordered the chicken Alfredo and was not happy with her choice.  We ordered desert and that was an additional 25 minute wait.  When we received our check, Erma stated that my meal and beverage was comp by the manager.  In actuality, we were charged for a extra Cajun Jambalaya.  We had to wait for the extra meal to be taken off our bill.  Best part of meal was the iced green tea.

First time I was ever disappointed at Cheesecake Factory. Ordered salmon salad off the regular salad menu, not the appetizer salads. Salmon was served cold, salad was nothing notable. Ordered a glass of Pinot noir and it was gross, not good wine at all. Def a disappointing visit. Could just be the items I picked.

My mom and I had lunch at Cheesecake Factory yesterday ( Monday ) afternoon. The place was packed but we were seating quickly and met our waiter shortly after seating. We ordered the lunch fish and chips and the lunch margarita pizza with Caesar salad. Food came out quickly but you could tell the fish was frozen and the pizza seemed like the lean cuisine ones you throw in the oven! Our waiter was M.I.A. for the most part of our luncheon, it took about 20 minutes just for us to get the bill. I will say the tiramisu cheesecake was perfect. Overall, I would not come back here.

I usually love the Cheesecake Factory. This experience was not up to par mostly due to service. It was busy but not overly crowded.<br>The waiter did not know what light dressings were available so brought regular instead. The food was brought out sporadically. There were three of us and we each got our food at different times delivered by different people. When I finally did get the light dressing it was horrible. It was the light mustard but had no taste. The rest of the food was delicious but the crab bites were expensive for the price. The Asian chicken tacos were great. I don&#39;t usually write reviews but I really like that Cheesecake Factory has a light menu that tastes good. I hope the one here gets its act together.

Everytime I go the food is great. Sometimes there are long lines but for the most part not much waiting. The molasses bread is my favorite. I love that there are so many choices on their menu so that whatever type I&#39;m in the mood for they have

I&#39;m a big fan of The Cheesecake Factory. I think I went too early, it was just open a few weeks, but there were some kinks. Overall, we ate (my wife, my 2 little girls and myself) and we agreed that we would go back and give it another shot. I love the ambiance and locality of it, right in the mall! Plus, where else can you get &#34;cheese cake this good?&#34;, no where!

I was at the mall today and in need of some lunch so I called to place an order for take-out! The girl on the phone seemed sweet, but a little confused when I asked to place an order for the Baja Chicken Tacos! She took my name, number and order and then told me they would be ready in about 20-25 minutes (which seemed a little long but I figured it was busy due to today being a holiday). I arrived about 22 minutes later and proceeded to the counter to get my order! Again the girl was very sweet, but a little unsure of herself! In fact she almost let me walk out without completely paying for my meal (I had a gift card that didn&#39;t cover it). However, the main reason for the two stars is I paid $15 (9 from the gift card and 6 out of pocket) for four tacos. No sides whatsoever were packed in my bag (it comes with rice and beans). I usually wouldn&#39;t say anything, but this isn&#39;t the first time this has happened to me (whether I was eating in or taking out). $15 for four tacos is simply unacceptable!

Standard Cheesecake Factory location. I thought it was common knowledge that they&#39;re known for their long menus and long waits, are people really complaining about this? CF is packed regardless of where it&#39;s located, so I would expect to wait an hour or so for a table, longer if you&#39;re going during peak times. Why not peruse through their 18 page long menu while you&#39;re waiting an hour for a table? Kill two birds with one stone. <br><br>This location gets an extra half star for having a text messaging system to notify you when your table is ready, and another half star for being attached to the mall. This means I can shop while I wait, therefore it doesn&#39;t feel like a wait. If I don&#39;t want/need to shop, I just go to Target (also in the mall) because c&#39;mon, you always need to grab something from Target. Again, use your noggin&#39; here, y&#39;all. <br><br>Food is well above average for a chain restaurant, service is always friendly (and the one time our food was taking a while to come out, we were proactively offered comped dessert due to the wait), and I&#39;ve never been unhappy with a meal here. My personal favorite is their ahi carpaccio, which I&#39;m guilty of ordering as my meal every time we go here. Give me all of the ahi tuna!

Love the Cheesecake Factory. Almost always impressed with what I order. Fried macaroni and cheese is a favorite. My friend likes the appetizer that&#39;s fried zucchini and mushrooms. The chicken Madeira and other pasta dishes that I&#39;ve tried are delicious. I&#39;ve also had great steak off a friends plate from here. Oh and the bread that they bring out to the tables is great.

I&#39;ve given this place plenty of tries and each experience is worst than the last. Wait staff, amazing at their  job. But they are always out of stuff. My most recent trip was last night. I wore a scarf and left it there by accident. Called this morning to make sure it was still there and it wasn&#39;t. But the fact that I had to sit on hold for 25 minutes to be told no, then click hung up on. Absolutely rude! I want my f**king scarf back.
Go at an off hour to get seats right away. Love the four cheese pasta and strawberry shortcake.

Decided to try this new restaurant for the first time. Settled on brunch. As we&#39;re walking in the front door we noticed a a really bad smell. Turns out the restaurant loads it garbage into the garbage truck next to the front door. There was spilled garbage and fluids across the parking lot where one would enter the restaurant. Food was ok service was. But couldn&#39;t seem to get that smell out of our heads. I did try to make contact with rest no response.

The worst cheese cake factory I&#39;ve ever been to. We were seated quickly, saw our waitress once to take our order, appetizers were luke warm. After the appetizers we didn&#39;t see our waitress for the next 45 minutes or so.  My plate was served by a different person and that too was luke warm. We asked for a manager since we couldn&#39;t even get a refill in our drinks and he did nothing, he himself actually took too long to get us the check. Worst part of all is I got food poisoning once I got home a few hours later. Never coming here again.

the place really bad the truth expected otherwise the meal was unpleasantly unpleasant we went to celebrate the birthday of a friend as a family and we really expected another quality of service and even attention food my mother spends all night after going out to eat from here and the truth we had another idea of ​​what could become Cheesecake Factory A Horrible Experience if you can avoid it do not go or come here.
Meatloaf was good. Garlick noodles were terrible. Pasta was not done correctly. Returned the dish. Very very noisy. Not a good environment. It will be a very long time before I return here.

Service is terrible- I&#39;ve been there twice dinning in and once for take out- they messed up my take out order which was annoying, and dinning in- we waited forever for our food to arrive and the second time- they were &#34;out of stock&#34; for what I wanted to order- which was frustrating. But I still love their cheesecake...

Food was okay and I got served cold pasta dish and the manager came and apologized with half his eyes closed and brought me another in a few mins - probably just took the old dish and microwaved it and the manager told me it was made all fresh

The food dishes come out pretty big for the price you pay. Extremely long lines, also we had a waiter that was supposed to come refill my drink and returned 10 times to our table with no drink. I ate my entire meal waiting for our drinks and he didn&#39;t even offer us a different drink. For paying 300$ I think they would have some better waiters.

I hate waiting 20-30 minutes for these chains and then the food is subpar.  Ordered the Americana Burger and it came 15 minutes after everyone else in my party and was burnt. Might as well go to McDonald&#39;s

When they first opened the food was very good but it has since gone die hill. Service is slow and food subpar. I went to the one at the Trumbull mall and I would have had a better meal at the food court.

Went for dinner on a slow Monday night with family (7 total) and got horrible service!  Even after asking, two of us didn&#39;t get appetizer plates and we had to ask for silverware.  No drink refills, and a very rude waitress treated us like an inconvenience.  They didn&#39;t clear the appetizer plates or serving dishes off the table.  The worst part of all is that they made an error with one of entrees and did not bring it out till everyone else was done eating.  The waitress downplayed the error, didn&#39;t acknowledge or apologize or offer any reconciliation.  Even when slow and fully staffed we were surprised to see such slow and bad service.  After asking the waitress if we were charged for the entree that didn&#39;t arrive until the end, the waitress said the manager is working on comping that plate, but upon receiving the check, it was still charged.  Will not be returning and do not recommend to others.

This place is my choice when heading home up the Merritt Parkway from New York City.  Once you get onto Route 15 you enter wilderness with no good restaurants until this one, in the big mall at Trumbull CT.  It&#39;s like most other Cheesecake Factories, solid, reliable, decent food.  Noisy but they all are

Since attending the opening last year, I have stopped in about a half dozen times. There&#39;s typically a long wait, which is pretty common for any Cheesecake Factory. The food here is good and consistent with other locations. So why the three stars? The food is a little bit pricey and I just feel like you could get homemade food at a small and charming restaurant one town over in Fairfield.

We had a very poor experience the last day of no tax Saturday. As you may imagine it was very crowded. We were told the wait would be 15 minutes and was actually 40 minutes. It took another 30 to 35 minutes to get our food. Altogether we were there for 2 hours. When the food came two of the three meals came together while the third took another 10 minutes. . Mediocre at best. The highlight of the meal was the fries which were very good. The Kobe burger was nothing special. Soup was too rich. Even the cheesecake was to dense and too sweet. They certainly could not handle a large crowd.
We are all about the Cheescake! We love the variety and they are so many to choose from! Definitely for the cheesecake fan! :)
The worst service and slowest kitchen imaginable. Walked out after waiting interminably long to receive the meal and was glad I did so. Spoke to others who had the exact same experience.

Absolutely terrible!!!! I waited an hour to be seated in a crowded almost cafeteria style like seating area. Then they took our order (for two people) and we waited another hour and no food or updates. The people who got there after us got their food before us. I dont know how they expect to have a menu thats 15 pages long (thats an exaggeration but still) and stay in business. Also there were flies everywhere flying around!
Never disappointed! Great menu! great drinks! And kid friendly. Awesome staff haven&#39;t had a bad experience yet!
Only reason 3 stars is there staff makes you wait so long for your cheesecake  and the entire menu is just too large.   Overall everything is good though

Save your time and money.  Very disorganized at the hostess station, waiter was attentive and tried best to do a good job.  Food is mediocre at best.  2 people in our party immediately had to use the bathroom after eating.   For the price paid go to a nice non corporate restaurant

Overpriced and not that good. LOVE the cuban rolls thats it !!When it first opened it was slightly better but why i  give it two stars is because of the nasty nasty staff in place right now!!    When they first opened i had never had a bad experience until recent months. Hostesses and whoever answers phones for take outs should be fired! Wish i knew who spoke to me the way they did one time while i was placing a take out order... they left me on hold for over 10 minutes then I called back and when she asked me to hold again I told her I was waiting while and I needed to place my order.  she was extremely rude to me and  reprimanded me that she had other customers and placed me on hold again!!! I drove all the way to the mall and still on hold walked into the Cheesecake Factory with my phone on hold and they were all standing around talking doing nothing no other customers in sight !!! The worst part was there phone line was ringing and they were all ignoring it.
Food was good, prices were fair, seated us fast and drinks were good ... So was the cheesecake as expected

Horribly unhealthy, crazy portioned food. This is a classic example of typical  &#34;American&#34; cuisine. Huge portions. A mountain of sodium and sugar per serving. The plus side is: convenience. It&#39;s a chain so certain standards such as decor and music are standardized by corporate. I am not a fan of chain restaurants and this is why: you cannot maintain the same quality of food when you have hundreds of locations. Quality is reduced to increase revenue. Cheesecake Factory is no exception. Contributing to the obesity epidemic with monstrous portions and lack of fresh ingredients is not a restaurant I want to support. If your with a big group of people who want to eat and want to eat big, this is the place to do it. Happy Hour is also pretty decent with half priced appetizers and discounted drinks. Although the drinks are watered down. Come here for CONVENIENCE. Nothing more. If this is your favorite place and you can&#39;t live without it, venture out more.
What can I say. We have been waiting forever for this place to open locally and it is finally here! And it delivers. Great food, good service and friendly waitstaff. Oh and the deserts were amazing.

If you read this, CF, know I will not return and it&#39;s mainly because of the exorbitant price of your coffee!! Really, 3.25 for a small cup??? Did Juan deliver the beans?? And, while I&#39;m at it, a glass of soda for the same price? I could buy a 6-pack!  Cheesecake slice, 7.95.  Nope, will not return.  There are many other choices out there.
loved the food drinks and service. Firecracker salmon is my fav.... in middletown, NY I&#39;ve tried others.... no match

Food is great. Servers are still pretty new. But not bad. I recommend that you order right away the kitchen it&#39;s still pretty slow. So if you are not in a hurry for good food this is definitely the place to go.

I have had hit and miss experiences at Cheesecake Factory. I went in to meet a friend for lunch and got sat right away, which was nice. There was four of us in total. Our waiter constantly checked in to see if we were ready to order which was a little annoying. It felt a little like we were being rushed. We put our orders in the food literally came out one by one. Everyone ordered something that needed to be cooked, I ordered a salad and mine came out last and like ten minutes after everyone else&#39;s food came out. Thankfully everything tasted really good! I&#39;d go back again but would really hope for some better service.

Keeping in mind that this location is brand new and just opened up for less than a month, they&#39;re still working out some kinks.  I&#39;ve always been a big Cheesecake Factory fan, which is why I wasn&#39;t surprised that this place was completely packed Sunday night.  If you are going in with a party of 2 it shouldn&#39;t be too bad, my wife and I waited for about 30 minutes but I like the fact that they have text message system rather than the little vibrating sensors that let you know your table&#39;s ready.  It allows you to go further away from the restaurant and shop the mall while you wait and not miss the alert.  Bigger parties, you&#39;ll probably be waiting an hour or more depending on what time you go.  <br><br>After reading the few reviews posted so far I was trying to keep my expectations in check and not being over hyped.  We had 2 waitresses attending our table which was great, probably 1 in training.  Joclyn was very professional and attentive.  We got our drinks and bread quickly and the bread was very fresh and still warm.<br><br>We ordered the Fire Cracker Salmon Rolls for appetizer which came out at a reasonable pace.  For entrees we had 2 different pastas, both arrived at the same time and still very hot and fresh.  I was also surprised that they were seasoned very well and portion size was excellent as usual with Cheesecake Factory.  <br><br>I couldn&#39;t say the same for the table next to us, they had some issues with their order (too much cheese on their pizza... wth?) <br><br>Anyway, we also got the banana cream cheese cake which was very smooth and delish. <br><br>Overall, we had an excellent experience this time and I hope it&#39;ll continue the next time we return.  I was happy with the service we received from Joclyn and no complaints about the food despite the other reviews and our neighboring table.  <br><br>There can be room for improvement at the entrance as it gets pretty crazy crowded during times and confusion occurs as some people picking up take out or just buying cheese cake get all mingled with the other restaurant guests waiting for tables. The front end people seemed kind of stressed as they don&#39;t really smile or act alert when guests try to get their attention, but I assume their just really trying to focus on seating everyone.
Vast menu keeps it interesting to try new things.  Glad they opened in our town.  Very enjoyable to lunch there after shopping.

The  so called &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu is still very fattening and bad for you. There are no healthy choices here. The cheese cake slices are standard. The best would have to be the classic cheesecake with strawberries on top. Overall a average place. There&#39;s also always a really long line to get in and it&#39;s really crowded and noisy. The bread they give you tastes good though, better than most entrees dishes they have here

Got take out from here. Standard meals. Messed that up. Cheese cakes were ok. Food was wrong. Had to drive back to change. Original food was let out for 20 min, not  recooked like manager said. Very disappointing. Cold food was mediocre at best. Terrible experience.

Huge disappointment.  Waited two hours after being told no more than 80 minutes.  Food was just okay. Did not compare to my experience at the west Hartford location which was exceptional.  Pasta and shrimp was bland and overcooked. no better than average diner food.

MIXED FOOD EXPERIENCE.  We went here on a Tuesday and were very surprised how busy this restaurant was.  The inside is very warm and inviting.  If it weren&#39;t for the windows leading to the inside of the Trumbull Mall, you&#39;d never know you were there.  We came to celebrate a birthday and were not disappointed in how the entire staff took the time to wish us a Happy Birthday.  <br><br>The mixed experience had to do with overall taste.  It clearly has to do with the overwhelming menu choices.  I&#39;ll list what we had and rate them individually due to the flavor inconsistencies.<br><br>1.  Avocado Rolls, 3 stars.  Chewy<br>2.  Chicken and Mushroom lettuce wrap, 4 stars.  I would have given it 5 stars but I got one piece of lettuce that was just the right size and the rest were too small for the filling.  Great flavor<br>3.  Cuban Sandwich 1 star.  It tasted nothing like a Cuban and had a sauce that was similar to tarter sauce, which made each bite unpleasant.<br>4.  Spicy Chicken Chipolte Pasta ,1 star and it was sent back due to unsavory flavor and it came with just a few chunks of chicken.<br>5.  Stuffed Chicken Tortillas, 2 stars.  Lacked flavor, was forgettable.<br>6.  Chicken Madeira, 5 stars.  Chicken was soft and flavorful.  It has plate licking qualities.<br>7.  Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane, 5 stars.  I already described the mouth watering chicken.  The steak was cooked to perfection and was satisfying to the palate.  <br>8.  Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake, 5 stars.  Big enough for two to share.<br>9.  Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake, 3 stars.  Big enough for two but too rich for my taste buds.<br><br>I was a little surprised that, for the prices they charge, a soup or salad was not included with our main course meals, 2 stars.  If you are going to charge these prices, you should be providing more.  A basic bottle of The Cheesecake Beringer wine was $32.<br><br>No one was overwhelmingly impressed with this dining experience.  I&#39;m glad we tried it, but probably will not return.  Too many unsatisfied taste buds to justify a return visit.

The organization of the restaurant has been spotty.  We have been ignored with the place half empty and not been assigned a waiter after sitting down.  We have sat in the bar and had 5 staff talking with no service because &#34; no one was assigned the table. &#34;. The food is good in terms of quality but management seems to be poor.
There are better options. Mediocre, overpriced food from a diner-sized menu. Their cheesecakes are good (if a bit decadent), but I wouldn&#39;t recommended going for a full meal.

The Food at The cheesecakefactory is sooo delicious. WE like it so much. And The staff is also very friendly. WE just moved Here from Germany and The Next Time WE will go there for Dinner very often :)))

Party of six. We left our name/number while we shopped as they don&#39;t take reservations. We shopped and 30 minutes later, our table was available. I received a text. Sooner than expected. The place was incredibly crowded! With more people pouring in.<br><br>The hostess was visibly frazzled. Folks in this position should be unflappable, gregarious &amp; all smiles!<br><br>Mel B. Was our server. Very warm + friendly. She started off VERY strong but finished VERY weakly. Nice but forgot about us mid meal. <br><br>My dish, orange chicken, which I always get at TCF was tasty, the plate was HOT, my food was lukewarm. How does that happen? I&#39;m not one to send food back. <br><br>Friend #1 ordered chicken wings off the app list. They were very salty. She has never been impressed with TCF &amp; her mind was not changed by her meal last night. Oh yeah, she ordered a salad with her wings...it arrived well after her wings were consumed. Even though she reminded our server about it as she ate her 3rd wing.<br><br>Friend #2 had skinnylicious enchilada. She thought they were fantastic. I took a forkful...I was not impressed @ all. Mushy and bland.<br><br>Friend #3 had a side salad and Philly steak + cheese. She loved it. <br><br>Friend #4 had the chicken chopped salad. According to the menu, it was supposed to be romaine, guess what? It was iceberg! It was on the soggy side. The chicken was barely there. She didn&#39;t send it back...we all know why!<br><br>Friend #6, a child, ordered the chicken sliders, with fruit salad. They were OK....she never received her cutlery, napkin. So we had to share with her. She went without a napkin, though we asked....SEVERAL TIMES!! <br><br>My takeaway? The menu is MASSIVE/ HUGE!!!!!! Jack of all trades, master of none comes to mind...except the orange chicken. Lol its never, ever bad. I&#39;ve had it at 3 different TCFs throughout New England. Always the same. Tough to get refills on water. Another server was kind enough to fill in while Mel B. was MIA. She brought over water &amp; salad dressing for friend #6s lettuce/tomato.<br><br>The cheesecakes...pineapple upside down, key lime, banana, dulce de leche, strawberry all good. They could do a nicer job of presenting them. I&#39;ve been to TCFs where the presentation was beautiful. <br><br>Will we return? YES! Will they always be busy? YES! This place will bring folks in who are not mall shoppers. We shopped after our meal and left after the mall closed. Folks were still lined up to get in!! The parking lot was jam packed.

Pleasantly surprised. The food was very good for a chain. Only down side was they were out of a few items and it took a while to get our drinks and silverware. Very busy that night... But the waitress was very nice.

We had a Great Family Dinner last night. The meal was fantastic and our waitress was Amazing. Her name is Carressa and I would recommend you ask for her when you arrive. She is friendly, kind and caring. We usually do not order dessert, but how can you pass up the Cheesecake. All 3 choices were Perfect!!

I have tried this location three times now and each it has declined!  Wrong items, cold food, burned food, and the list goes on so have not been back!  Against my own judgement my family is having a reunion and asked to dine there - I called and was told no reservations for a party of 25+.  Asked to speak to a manager and was put on hold for 20 minutes by Kayla and left only to be disconnected!  Called again and was put on hold again and after 10 more minutes yet again to be disconnected.  Considering my past experiences and the challenge to speak to someone above the age of 16 who is not rude, crude and socially unacceptable, I have moved on and will dine elsewhere!  I have never nor will I ever bend over backwards to give my money to a location that feels above the rest!  Over time, this restaurant will fail as the reviews below only enforce each of MY experiences!

Ok, let&#39;s start here: the smell is disgusting. So gross. Over the summer, after a long day of shopping at the mall, me, my mom, my sister, my grandmother, my aunt and cousin decided to have dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. We walk in and it&#39;s PACKED. We say how many people we are and ask about the wait. They said about 45 mins to an hour. Ok. We have nothing else better to do anyway.  We wait and wait and wait. Then, I went with my sister into the bathroom, and lo and behold, there was VOMIT everywhere. Chunky vomit. And no one was cleaning it up. We high tail it outta there and wait some more. We finally get a table and order. I got enchiladas from the &#34;healthy&#34; menu. They tasted like armpits. Then it was time for the cheesecake, probably the best part of this whole dinner. Me and my sister got the peanut butter cheesecake and it was So. Good. That was the only thing saving that experience tbh. Not the best.

We finally decided to use gift certificates that we were given for Christmas several years ago. I wasn&#39;t expecting anything exciting, just basic.The place was very busy to begin with. We had to wait for 30 minutes so we walked around the mall. When I opened the menu I was overwhelmed by the extensive list of choices. I kept saying to myself with all of these choices how can the food be any good. It was a long time before we finally got glasses of water and then awhile more before our wine arrived. We wanted to start with the ricotta and meatballs appetizer but after placing the order Lauren came back and said they were out so we decided on the roasted pear and blue cheese flat bread. It arrived and the pears did not look roasted and were cut in large chunks(should have been much much smaller or thinly sliced) but overall it had good flavor. Bread never came to the table and we didn&#39;t think to ask until we were half way done with the meals. Oh and another thing it took forever to get utensils and napkins. We had to use the cocktail napkin with the appetizer. I ordered the Shepard&#39;s pie with apprehension but have not had it in ages and was curious. It was actually really good, I was very surprised for a chain restaurant to make it very tasty. My other half had the chicken marsala and he said it had good flavor but needed more sauce and wished the pasta had been cooked a bit more. I was hoping the lemon cake was on the dessert menu because I had it several years ago at the Fort Lauderdale location and thought it was good. They changed it a bit but it was still quite good. My other half had the dulce de leche cheesecake and enjoyed it very much. Overall not a bad experience but service was lacking and needs to be fixed. We were supposed to get refills on the water and that never happened. Someone is not doing their job.

Very good restaurant. I will start with the bad first. The two-party seating is very close together and the restaurant gets very busy.  There are no reservations and the wait time can be 2 to 2 1/2 hours on a busy weekend. The restaurant does however have a text message notification system that will alert you when your table is ready via text message; so you can walk around the mall while you&#39;re waiting.  I have never had to wait longer than an hour.<br><br>I have been to Danbury, Palisades Mall and West Hartford.  This restaurant definitely puts out some of the better food.  The portions are plenty, the presentation is neat and the quality is there.<br><br>The front of house staff is usually very good; personable and well-trained.  I have been there five times and only once had a waiter that was average, the rest were great.<br><br>Best time to go is off hours on a weekday.
My husband and I went to the Cheesecake Factory today.  Service was very good .  Our waiter very nice and quick.  Food was excellent.

The portions are big yet the food is so-so at best.   My husband had a Mexican dish that he barely touched (he never leaves food on his plate), my son who eats us out of house and home left his eggplant parm on his plate, my gumbo was definitely not the kind you would find in any New Orleans restaurant, and the deep-fried macaroni and cheese landed in the stomach like a lead balloon.  The cheesecake doesn&#39;t make the rest of the meal any more worth eating.  No, this is no longer on our list of places to eat out.

Always had good food and good service at this one. Until tonight when the food gave me food poisoning. It&#39;s really disappointing too because I did actually like this place and I probably won&#39;t go back for a really long because of this.

I have been to a number of different Cheesecake Factory throughout the years. But my latest experience at Trumble was the worst one. The service was bad (waited for at least 15 minutes to get greeted by our waitress), dirty utensils, broken glass ( at the rim!!). Worst of all, unavailable dishes 15 minutes after we ordered!

Wish i can leave 0 stars. My girlfriend and I are currently at cheesecake factory in the mall. Service is absolutely terrible!!! Walked in asked for a table for 2 the host told us 15 minutes (no problem) 20 minutes goes by nothing.... 25 minutes later I have to go up and ask where our table is. The host brought us around the entire restaurant to find us the table and nothing. We ended up going back up to where the host office was waited for another 10 minutes before I had to grab the manager. The manager apologized and looked for a table for us finally after another 5 minutes we sat down. We ordered our drinks and food since we knew what we wanted already and asked for them to bring out the bread. We received our drinks then 12 minutes later our dinner but still no bread. Asked for the bread again didn&#39;t come for another 15 minutes by that time we were done with our meal. Didn&#39;t even bother ordering desert wanted to get out as soon as I can!!

I was SOOOOO excited for this chain to come near me so I could go, it had been almost 25 years since my friend married in California.<br><br>I was WAY early as it was tax free week in Trumbull, CT and prime lunch time. They sat me 10 minutes after I got there even though my other two members weren&#39;t there yet. (MUCH appreciated) and I nursed an Iced Tea for 20 minutes.Two servers watched me the whole time and then again once they arrived and again, until we were ready.  (MUCH appreciated). A welcome gift, SOURDOUGH bread, and WARM!<br><br>The menu is like a book, you really need 20 minutes to even look through the food, if you want a drink, there&#39;s another 10.<br><br>They have something to please every craving, Chinese, Mexican, American, like HUNDREDS of options including diet/&#34;Skinny&#34;.<br><br>We started with Fried Zucchini and Fire Cracker Shrimp.  Both were good. 4/5.<br><br>Entrees were Skinny Shrimp Tacos, BBQ Ranch Chix Salad and 1/2 portion of Shrimp Scampi w/ tomato.<br><br>We ended with the Coconut Choc Chip Cheesecake. <br><br>We were stuffed, but it was pricey, thus the non 5 star rating. The staff was very nice and well trained. I am sorry for those that went at the first opening and got bad service. <br><br> I will give this place a 5 star when I go and I don&#39;t spend $100 for 3 people for lunch. Even though this place isn&#39;t really overpriced that much.

I&#39;m well-versed in &#34;The Cheesecake Factory Experience,&#34; being that I went to college in Washington DC and frequented many a Cheesecake Factory in my undergraduate heyday.  I&#39;m aware of the long waits for a table, ridiculously huge menu, and obscene portion sizes.  So now, 11 years after finishing college and living back in CT, I was both surprised and curious when a Cheesecake Factory opened in the good ol&#39; Trumbull Mall.<br><br>The long and short of it is:  My sister and I are both mothers of babies.  She has TWIN newborn sons who sleep all day and I have a 9 month old who - for right now, anyway - is pretty good at restaurants.  We met at the mall (with our mom in tow) to get out of our houses for the afternoon and grab a bite to eat.  I was expecting to do a harried lunch down at the food court but in a moment of somewhat blind ambition, we decided to inquire about a table at the Cheesecake Factory.  My sister prefaced her request to the hostess with a &#34;you&#39;re gonna LOVE us...&#34; and explained that we needed a table for 3 adults, 1 highchair, with room for a double stroller, and - oh yeah -  space to park another stroller.  The very friendly host said it wasn&#39;t a problem and there was barely any wait (it was exactly 12 noon on a Thursday).  Score!<br><br>After a few moments during which they seated a few other patrons, we were ushered into a large booth where lo and behold, all 3 of us ladies could sprawl out, the boys could nap alongside the table and my daughter could hang out in a highchair, which was brought over immediately.  And we could leave her stroller alongside the barrier/wall between the bar and the restaurant.  2 for 2, Cheesecake.<br><br>Our incredibly sweet waitress came over immediately to take drink orders, sensitive to the fact that there were 3 babies with us and we would need to a.) probably eat quickly and b.) may need to make a quick getaway in case one of them had a meltdown.  She didn&#39;t rush us at all, but we ordered everything ASAP, and it was all brought out within a reasonable time frame.  Every server who stopped by to deliver a drink/snack/meal was very helpful and friendly, even stopping to pick up one of my daughter&#39;s socks that she had inevitably dropped on the floor.  No one cared when she ate the finger foods I had brought from home (in addition to the meatballs I ordered for her).<br><br>The food was tasty and the service was great.  The restaurant, being brand-spankin&#39; new, is really open/airy, clean, and has good music playing.  And all three tiny humans were well-behaved and in good spirits.  I realize had we come at a different time of day (dinner vs. lunch, weekend vs. weekday), the wait would have been crazy and the babies would have definitely lost it.  But that&#39;s why I don&#39;t bring my kid out during the &#34;witching hour&#34;.  :)<br><br>All in all, I appreciate any public place that opens its doors to families of all sizes and doesn&#39;t bat an eyelash when asked to accommodate parents of newborns.  It was my sister&#39;s first time bringing the boys out to eat and we are very glad that the Cheesecake Factory is now in her &#34;restaurant repertoire&#34; - we will be back for lunch again!  Thanks Cheesecake!

Although I have never ate in I love the take out. The Oreo cheesecake is to die for! Vanilla bean with glazed strawberries is another fave. And the chocolate chip cookie dough. I love ordering their entire cheesecakes. I only wish they were pre-sliced. The menu is also pretty good they have orange chicken, pizza, all types of good eats.

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory several times, the service is good, the quality of the food has always been good and I really can&#39;t complain. It&#39;s a chain, so I don&#39;t expect to be served a gourmet meal.
Doesnt even deserve a star. Long wait. They said it would be 40 minutes and it was over 2 hours. Very disappointing

Not impressed at all. The long wait for Cheesecake Factory to arrive and after one visit, im dont. Food was average at best, service was poor. Over priced for a below average experience and average food.

Excellent food and even better customer service! I&#39;ve been here on multiple occasions and have never been disappointed!! I&#39;ve had the same waitress Azzalee twice and I&#39;m still impressed with the phenomenal customer service I receive! I will return soon!!!!

We have enjoyed the Cheesecake Factory in other locations, but were disappointed with our family&#39;s first visit to the new Trumbull site.  There was a minimal wait that evening to be seated, which was a pleasant departure from typical one hour waits at the company&#39;s restaurants.  Unfortunately, we were repeatedly reminded by our servers just how busy they were and left waiting for long periods to order our food and be served.  When a dinner arrived with the wrong side vegetable, the server dismissively insisted it was correct (it was not) and added that the desired vegetable would require an additional charge.  Another server arrived a moment later with our remaining order and immediately agreed it was the wrong side vegetable and promptly replaced it.  We subsequently ordered 3 deserts to go and after an interminable wait of more than twenty minutes opted to cancel that order rather than to continue to wait.  A manager came over to apologize and explain how incredibly busy the bakery was from many walk-in orders.  She described a perplexing process where despite our being a customer at the restaurant for the past hour, upon ordering our desert we were now at the mercy of a ticketing queue in the bakery.  She suggested there was nothing she could do about the wait and offered absolutely nothing else (e.g. free desert; some discount upon a return visit; etc.) for our inconvenience. This is unacceptable and much better service and response is expected given that dining for a family of four at the restaurant is not inexpensive.

Went here for my birthday, not too super! We got a table right away even though it was busy. Our server took a long time to get us our appetizers and he kept ignoring us. I think he had too many tables. We also told him that we wanted a cheesecake to go and bring home to sing happy birthday to our kids and he said no problem. Had fish and chips which was ok but the fries were cooked to death. After waiting another long wait to get our bill we left and went to get our cheesecake only to find out that the cakes are frozen and it would be 2 hours till the cake was defrosted. The server never mentioned this to us and it was disappointing because we wanted to take a cake home to sing happy birthday with our kids. We talked to the manager and she made excuses and didnt offer us anything even an apology. Wife called the next day to complain and another manager took our info and sent us a giftcard in the mail. Glad they followed up and hope the place is better when we go there again.
I would have given 0 stars. My food was not cooked- raw hamburger.   Other food was cold.  Service was very very slow. So disappointing!

this is place is usually good but our last visit last weekend was by far the worst, we were seated  after a 15-20 min wait, we sat down and after 20 mins we noticed we weren&#39;t the only people not being served, there was a total of 5 other tables with no waiter or waitress, finally we and other people got up to say something and it took forever for them to get us some service still how horrible. finally some other waiters were told to help our section and they took our orders for drinks and appetizers and the waitress let us know that they were short staffed because some waiters, waitresses were cut off early....... finally we got our drinks after a 20-30 minute wait, our appetizer came out right after, than we sat for an hour for our food to come out. I ordered a pasta and when it finally came out it tasted like it was seafood cross contaminated. A small Manager Lady came over and apologized for the service , she said oh I&#39;m guessing your not a seafood fan, the point is I didn&#39;t order a seafood pasta. instead I ordered a factory burrito , after we were all finished up our bill came out and it wasn&#39;t even right she never removed the pasta, had to literally do there job for them, we left almost 2 hours later. the manager is id say a Rookie and should find another job

Terrible experience here. We went out expecting to enjoy a good meal and left with a very sour taste in our mouths (literally). My girlfriend and I each ordered two different meals containing chicken in it. They put the food down and immediately we both smelled something funny but kind of just kept to ourselves, maybe it could&#39;ve been all the spices etc. (I got the baja chicken tacos and she got the chicken picatta for the record). After our first bites we knew something was off, it tasted very strong and one quick smell of it and you could tell clear as day that it was spoiled. We notified our waitress and she was great about it, however the manager came over and also asked what was wrong. She proceeded to say she smelled it and she could not smell anything and was very rude about the entire thing. She took absolutely no blame for the matter implying it couldn&#39;t possibly be the restaurants fault as they &#34;pound fresh chicken everyday&#34;. Anyone with a working nose or sense of taste would have noticed this, trust me. She then saw us walking out and didn&#39;t even say sorry. Awful management!

Had my first and last visit to this place this past weekend. After a 50 minute wait to be seated, our drink orders were taken promptly but about ten minutes before we saw them, or the waiter again. I had ordered a glass of wine. When reaching for the glass when it finally arrived, it was sticky on the outside of the glass- so sticky that when I picked it up, the napkin which it sat upon was lifted too.  I told the waiter, he took it back, another ten minutes before I saw him again telling me that all the wine glasses were in the dishwasher. Finally got the wine, second glass not in much better shape. The food was ok- nothing to brag about but not bad either. Then dessert time. My husband ordered hazelnut crusted cheesecake. After again an unusually lengthy wait, we were told that the cheesecake he ordered was frozen- we could have it to go only. Also, a very noisy place. Overall fair food, service which could have been a lot better, questionable clean glasses, the noise.....will not go back.

Most people who go into a Cheesecake Factory know what to expect. It&#39;s not fine dining, just reliable, occasionally excellent food. The cheesecakes are of course the main event, but if you stick to their signature dishes like the Chicken Madeira or the Asian Chicken Salad, you&#39;ll come away satisfied. My wife once ordered filet mignon...I was like, why would you order a $30 steak at a Cheesecake Factory? But you know what? It was absolutely delicious, as good as Capital Grille. This outlet is always crazy busy so get there early and be prepared to wait 45 min to an hour for a table.

Not sure what to say about this place except for incredibly inconsistent. When it&#39;s a good night there, it&#39;s great! When it&#39;s not a good night, it&#39;s really bad. I&#39;ve been here probably about 10 times and sometimes servers are great and other times they&#39;re terrible. Some of the food is really great! Other dishes are not. Bread is great when it comes out warm, but can be terrible when it comes out cold. I sometimes ask for special requests because of dietary restrictions or preferences and some times it&#39;s perfect, other times I have sent the meal BACK TWICE. I really want to love this place but unfortunately it&#39;s a bit difficult sometimes. I will say, however, that their apple crisp, Godiva cheesecake, and cookie dough cheesecake are great and have always enjoyed those!

My husband and I came here after the lunch rush today and have never had a worse experience at a Cheesecake Factory location. After being seated, drinks took between 8-10 minutes. Then we were told they didn&#39;t have the appetizer we originally wanted so we chose another. The spinach dip was bland and the chips were greasy. My husband ordered the farfalle without peas and I had the pit beef dip sandwich. The food took way too long to arrive (about 25 minutes). When we did get the food, the sandwich was bland, tough, and dried out like it had been sitting under the salamander for too long. My husband&#39;s pasta had peas in it. Since our waitress never came by to check on us, we had to flag down someone else to get a new pasta. Our waitress let us know the manager was on top of it making it himself in the kitchen and it came out fairly quickly and tasted fine. At no point did our waitress ever check on us, or apologize for the duration of our visit. When the bill arrived, they charged us twice for the re-made pasta. We didn&#39;t even want to stay for dessert since what was supposed to be a quick lunch was an hour and 15 minutes of disappointment. Never again, Trumbull.

Awful. I was very excited for a Cheesecake factory to open near me and it was extremely disappointing and frustrating. Food took over 1hr and 15min to get to us after ordering, and we were there for 30 min prior to ordering.

I visited this location on February 23rd. When we arrived it took 10 minutes to seat us which was no big deal. Once we sat we ordered drinks and food quickly. Drinks took a little while but again no big deal. Dinner on the other hand took an hour. Not only that but the waitress came to check on us only once during that hour and never came to say they are running behind or anything like that. Once we got our food next time we saw the waitress we ordered our desserts 2 red velvet cheesecake slices, 1 smores cheesecake slice, a rocky road ice cream, and an Oreo milkshake. The milkshake came out after fifteen minutes. Cheesecakes came out fifteen minutes after that and the rocky road took fifteen minutes longer than that. How does an ice cream take 45 minutes? At first I sent this review on the 25th to just them on there website but they did not even reply in over a week. Would not recommend unless you want to waste 2 hours of your life waiting for ok food and being ignored by the waiters.
Christmas Eve, large original cheesecake....disappointed.  Four hours after pickup, frozen in middle, then got all melty.  $50.00 mess!

After being told 75 minutes it took 128 minutes to be seated. We were served our meal fast but the eggplant was undercooked.  The hamburger was just fair. It took way too long for desert and we finally asked for it to go. My first and last time going to a Cheesecake Factory. Very disappointed.
The bistro shrimp pasta dish was delicious, but the shrimp were overdone. This dish would&#39;ve been even better if the shrimp were sautéed instead of deep fried in batter.

I have been here 3 or 4 times, alm have been pleasant. One time there was a child next to me that broke a dish and was being disruptive, the waiter did wverything he could to make our experience as nice as possible. Every person we have had there is friendly and eager to please, the food is always tastey.

A small group of us went to grab a quick bite later in the evening. The wait for the dining area was 15-20, but a bar high top table was available so we took that. Quick service, decent food and drinks and an overall solid place to stop for something to eat later in the evening. Our waitress Mellisa was pleasant and worked quickly to get us what we needed.

My favorite place to eat when I&#39;m in the mall. Louisiana chicken pasta &amp; chicken di pans are the best. The food is a little pricey but I get what I pay for &amp; more. The staff is very nice, always gets a warm hello from the hostesses &amp; my servers so far have been great! I recommend asking for Lori, Stacy or Azzalee! We had an issue with our check but one of the managers came over &amp; took care of everything. The only bad thing is that the floors can get quite dirty but I usually notice that when ok weekend nights only when it&#39;s crazy busy. &amp; I don&#39;t recommend going there weekend nights with a big group, you&#39;ll be looking at a long wait. I&#39;ve witnessed a lot of people get crazy because they&#39;re are 5 mins over there wait. It&#39;s not that serious lol that&#39;s why they say ABOUT xx mins.

I&#39;ve been to the Trumbull location twice, the first time was in 2014 and the second time was this past Saturday. When my friend and I went to the Cheesecake Factory last year it was a very scary first experience. My friend was eating the portabella mushroom, avocado and zucchini fries when she realized that there were pieces of metal wire in her food. We complained to a manager about the issue. The manager explained to us that the wire baskets used to cook the fried food must have frayed and that explains why the wire was in the food. They said they would fix the problem and that they would change to newer baskets. They ended up refunding our money for the appetizer but that was all that was offered to us. Thankfully my friend did not choke or swallow the medal wire. It could have been very dangerous. After that my friend and I lost our appetite. We paid for our bill and left without finishing our food. <br><br>A year later I received a gift card to the Cheesecake Factory and decided to give it a second chance. My friend and I decided to go there for lunch on Saturday. It was very crowded. When we walked up to the hostess counter she barely greeted us or looked us and instructed the other hostess to seat us at table number 70. She never asked if we wanted a booth or a table. The table was very small and very close to the people next to us. Before we could complain or ask to be moved, the hostess walked away from us without asking us if we liked the table. It was very uncomfortable to be sitting that close to the other table. Since the hostess was no where in sight, my friend and I decided to take matters into our own hands and we moved ourselves to one of the empty private booths. After a couple of minutes, the hostess noticed we moved to another table. She came over to us, took our menus away from us and told us that there is a waiting list for a booth. After getting treated poorly and feeling like the hostess embarrassed us, we left the restaurant and decided to cool off for a bit. I didn&#39;t want the gift card to go to waste so I went back inside and put my name on the waiting list for a booth. After 20 minutes I got a text message and retuned back into the restaurant to be seated. It took another 10 minutes to be seated. It also took a while for the waitress to come to our table to take our drink and food order. We had ceasar salads, which weren&#39;t bad but the salad dressing was a little on the strong side. Since the place is called the Cheesecake Factory we decided to give the cheesecakes a try. We ordered the original cheesecake and the dulce de leche caramel cheesecake. Neither of us finished our cheesecakes. They tasted very sour. It was the worst cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had. <br><br>I don&#39;t know if its just the Trumbull location but I feel like the Cheesecake Factory is very overhyped and overpriced. After two stressful and disappointing experiences I have decided that I will not be giving the Cheesecake Factory another chance in the future. I will not be going back.

So, brought my son there for his 20th bday.   We ordered srinks and our seerver came back after ten mins thats its another 10 mins then when we got out drinks mine was soo strong and my friends was all juice and let. Me add, we ordered the same drink.  Then the food.  OMG really.  Chicken marsala. NOT. Had it taken off my bl. The food in 1 word SUCKED....  Never willi I ever eat at the Cheesecake Factory again.. it sucked from beginning to end.  Oh, let me say, been in this business over 30  yrs. Yuck gross food. And they wont take reservations, we waited over an hour for crap food. Our server was ok though. Tell them to introduce them selves..... night.

The wait was long and we did not enjoy the food. we never ate there before so when we ordered a large cheese the waitress should have said sorry theres only a small but she didnt and it was horrible I have no idea where they got their recipe from but definitely stay away. We couldnt bite the chicken off the wings we had to gnaw at it. The only thing tasty was the cheesecake maybe they should stick to just that oh yea the fries were average nothing special but at least they were ok. Theres more just dont want to write a book and mind you we wrote to the cheesecake factory online and of course we got no reply. Definitely too pricey for their horrible food.

This is probably the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to and I&#39;ve been to several. I ordered the antioxidant salad and was super excited to try this healthy salad for the first time. The salad came and the lettuce and kale were both soggy and unappetizing. The manager, very friendly, came over and apologized and offered to make a fresh one. After some time she came back and guaranteed that she had checked the salad herself and the lettuce was indeed fresh. It was not, the same texture and sogginess existed. I was the offered to replace my dish for he third time and  decided to go for something that I know I like. After 25 minutes, my dish finally came and the luau salad was the worst one I have ever had. Soaked in dressing AND the lettuce yet again, Was not fresh. I&#39;m usually not one to complain and this is the first time I&#39;ve felt the need to leave a review. I am always satisfied with my order when I come to cheesecake, but this time was just something else. Needless to say I will not be going back to this cheesecake location again.
